analytics_data_disagree_body: No problem. We won't use your gameplay information to improve Star Trek: Legends!

Data_Character_BorgQueen_description: The deadly 'queen bee' of the Borg Collective and one of humanity's greatest nightmares. Her background is unknown, but her goal is clear: the complete assimilation of all organic life.
Data_Character_Burnham_description: The adopted human sister of Spock, Burnham serves aboard the U.S.S. Discovery. Fiercely intelligent, driven, with a moral drive that occasionally brings her into conflict with her superior officers.
Data_Character_Chang_description: An old school Klingon warrior. Despite his appreciation for Earth culture, he foresees the end of the Klingon Empire if the Federation continues to advance and is willing to do anything to prevent this occurring.
Data_Character_Chekov_description: A true polymath, Pavel Chekov has served in multiple roles including security, navigation and tactics. He excels in all of them, while always maintaining his trademark good cheer.
Data_Character_Crusher_description: A selfless doctor whose past accomplishments include serving as Head of Starfleet Medical. A consummate team player always willing to put the needs of her colleagues first.
Data_Character_Culber_description: Medical officer aboard the U.S.S. Discovery. A kind-hearted man who always fights for his patients and is willing to stand up to authority on their behalf.
Data_Character_Data_description: Commander Data is the first android ever to serve in Starfleet. Despite his super-human strength, agility and intelligence, he pursues an endless quest to become more human.
Data_Character_Doctor_description: The Doctor is an Emergency Medical Hologram (EMH) Mark I, a walking, talking comependium of medical expertise. The Doctor continues to learn and evolve as he serves aboard the U.S.S. Voyager.
Data_Character_DreamlessA_MiniBoss_descr: An unknown but a powerful entity that inhabits the Nexus.
Data_Character_DreamlessB_Boss_descripti: An unknown but extremely powerful entity that inhabits the Nexus.
Data_Character_Dukat_description: Dukat is a 'gul', a high-ranking commander in the Cardassian armada. His practiced charm hides an insidious, power-hungry mindâ€¦ one willing to sell out anyone or anything for power.
Data_Character_Elnor_description: A survivor of the Romulan supernova event, Elnor was evacuated to Vashti by Admiral Picard. As an adult, he became a rare, male adjunct of the Qowat Milat, an order of warrior nuns. Their training has left him almost unmatched in martial combat.
Data_Character_Garak_description: A seemingly mild-mannered Cardassian tailor, Garak is a former member of the Obsidian Order, the intelligence agency of his people's' government. An able assassin, saboteur and consummate spymaster.
Data_Character_GenBorgEng01M_description: The Borg equivalent of a worker-bee. Quiet, efficient and usually focused on repairing any damage nearby. Most ignore intruders as they're seen as too irrelevant to bother with.
Data_Character_GenBorgMed01M_description: While the Borg don't have doctors, they do have drones built specifically to repair disabled units and keep the Collective active. Somewhere between butchers and mechanics.
Data_Character_GenBorgSci01M_description: A form of Drone adapted to enhance their technical processing power. They take an active role when planets or ships are assimilated; helping harvest the captives.
Data_Character_GenBorgSec01M_description: A Borg Drone specifically designed for heavy combat. They're usually equipped with durable shields and a range of weapons appropriate to the encounter and environment.  A truly terrifying foe.
Data_Character_GenCardCom01M_description: The Cardassian Empire is famed throughout the Quadrant as a brutal place, one where absolute loyalty to the state is demanded and only the strongest are allowed to rise.  Such a person is the Cardassian Commander.
Data_Character_GenCardEng01F_description: The Cardassian counterpart to Starfleet's engineering crews. The majority are female, as most males lack the technical acumen required to keep ships and equipment running smoothly.
Data_Character_GenCardMed01M_description: Cardassian doctors are just as ruthless as the rest of their military, eager to increase their knowledge at any cost. Rumors of torture and reprogramming are more than just Federation propaganda.
Data_Character_GenCardSci01F_description: A member of the Cardassian Science Ministry, an organization tasked with ensuring that any of the more dangerous military inventions are... palatable... to the general population.
Data_Character_GenCardSec01M_description: The rank and file of the Cardassian war machine. Each is raised from the cradle to believe in the superiority of their Empire and their right to dominate the Alpha Quadrant.
Data_Character_GenHumanCom01M_descriptio: To become the Commander of a Starfleet vessel is an honor, reserved for the brightest and best. Each is trained in tactics, negotiations, philosophy and all manner of studies that help promote the Federation philosophy as they expand throughout the Quadrant.
Data_Character_GenHumanEng01F_descriptio: Starfleet engineers are trained to think on their feet, prepared for any eventuality, and able to adapt any technology, alien or otherwise, to meet the needs of their ship.
Data_Character_GenHumanMed01M_descriptio: Starfleet's medical personnel provide essential support to every ship and colony to which they're assigned. All are extensively trained in xenobiology to serve the wide range of species that make up the Federation.
Data_Character_GenHumanSci01F_descriptio: Starfleet scientists embody the core tenets of Starfleet's mission: curiosity, exploration, discovery, and the quest to increase knowledge of the universe beyond.
Data_Character_GenHumanSec01M_descriptio: The "red tunics" provide the backbone of all Starfleet expeditions. Dedicated and resourceful, rumors of their high mortality rate are (mostly) overstated.
Data_Character_GenKlingCom01M_descriptio: A leader used to a crew renowned throughout the quadrant as some of the finest warriors in existence.  Each flies into battle knowing that their ancestors are watching and determined to make them proud.
Data_Character_GenKlingEng01F_descriptio: If you need a ship repaired fast and with brutal efficiency, the Klingon Engineer is the crew member you need. If you're lucky they might throw in a few blood stained banners or smoldering vents for a bit of local 'flavor'.
Data_Character_GenKlingMed01M_descriptio: A medic although one who's a bit more... rudimentary than their Starfleet equivalents. Each was born into a culture where death in battle was considered an honor, after all...
Data_Character_GenKlingSci01F_descriptio: While Klingons have a reputation for being warriors, they've been responsible for some of the greatest technological advances seen in the Quadrant. Such works are built by their scientists who are a welcome addition to any crew.
Data_Character_GenKlingSec01M_descriptio: What one would expect from a Klingon soldier.  Each is powerful, loyal and brave; devoted to the defense of their people.
Data_Character_GenRomuCom01M_description: A blade of the Empire, forged in its fires and finally given command of one of their Warbirds. All are skilled in battle but also in survival: each knows that at any moment they could be betrayed and lose their position of power.
Data_Character_GenRomuEng01F_description: Romulan engineers are not as safety-conscious as their Federation counterparts. Efficiency and lethality are their guiding principles, all in service to the greater Empire.
Data_Character_GenRomuMed01M_description: Part of the Romulan medical corp. Each is extremely well trained but, unlike their Federation counterparts tend to specialize primarily on their own species.
Data_Character_GenRomuSci01F_description: Romulan scientists are all too willing to push the boundaries of scientific ethics. They've been responsible for some of the quadrants' greatest inventions... and some of its worse horrors.
Data_Character_GenRomuSec01M_description: Warriors charged with eliminating threats to the Romulan Empire. They are adept at physical confrontations but also are well versed at dealing with spies and other forms of subterfuge that dominate the empire's politics.
Data_Character_Geordi_description: Despite being born blind, Geordi has worked his way up from helmsman to Chief Engineer of the U.S.S. Enterprise. His VISOR allows him to "see" things beyond the limit of human sight.
Data_Character_Georgiou_description: The former leader of the Terran Empire, now a Section 31 operative. Cold and ruthless, she'll sacrifice millions for the sake of her ambitions. Her only weakness is her fondness for her adopted daughter, Michael Burnham.
Data_Character_Gorn_description: An alien species first encountered by Captain Kirk and the Enterprise. Their reptilian physiology grants incredible strength and endurance: the Gorn are widely considered one of the most physically powerful of the known races.
Data_Character_Janeway_description: The famous captain of the U.S.S. Voyager. Her tenacity and brilliance helped save her ragtag crew as they ventured deeper into uncharted space than any previous Starfleet vessel.
Data_Character_Khan_description: A 20th century Augment dictator woken from cryosleep by the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise centuries later. Gifted by a eugenics program that made him smarter, faster and stronger than regular men... but far more arrogant.
Data_Character_Kirk_description: Captain James Tiberius Kirk is arguably the most legendary captain in Starfleet history. His quick thinking, boldness and charisma have saved the lives of his crew - and saved the Federation - countless times.
Data_Character_Locutus_description: A nightmare created when Captain Picard was assimilated by the Borg. Possessing all of the Captain's tactical genius and knowledge of Starfleet protocols, Locutus retained only a shred of his humanity.
Data_Character_Lorca_description: One of Starfleet's best, a decent, hardworking captain loved by his crew.  Or... so he'd like you to believe.  Lorca is from the Mirror-Universe and, like that place, a black hearted reflection of the man he replaced. Malicious, scheming and hungry for power, no one should take their eyes off him. Ever.
Data_Character_Martok_description: A famed Klingon who acted as the chief commander of their forces during the 24th century. Considered by military historians to be an excellent tactician with a rare ability to bond with his troops.
Data_Character_McCoy_description: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain Kirk. A gruff man famous for his sardonic sense of humour, his broad set of skills and, more than anything else, his inherent humanity.
Data_Character_Nerys_description: A Bajoran ally of the Federation, working on the Deep Space Nine station after its liberation from Cardassian forces. A determined patriot devoted to her people, Kira never accepts defeat.
Data_Character_Nine_description: Assimilated by the Borg as a child, Seven is one of the few survivors of the Borg's brutality. Her remaining cybernatic enhancements make as lethal in combat as she is brilliant in strategy.
Data_Character_Odo_description: A mysterious shapeshifter rescued by Bajorans, Odo rose to become the security officer of the Deep Space Nine station. Gruff, solitary and possessed of a firm sense of justice.
Data_Character_Phlox_description: Arguably one of the greatest doctors in Starfleet history. Phlox is a Denobulan, an alien race eager to learn more about their new human neighbours. A xenobiologist without peer.
Data_Character_Picard_description: Widely considered one of the greatest captains in Starfleet history. Renowned as a tactician, thinker and diplomat, Captain Picard strives to uphold the ideals of the Federation, no matter the challenges he faces.
Data_Character_PicardDixon_description: A famous fictional detective loved by Picard and occasionally played by him on the Holodeck of the Enterprise. Dixon is pure 'pulp', a two fisted hero as adept with a tommy gun as he is with the ladies.
Data_Character_Pike_description: Former captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise. A kind, decent man doomed to suffer a terribly injury that leaves him voiceless and immobile.
Data_Character_Quark_description: A Ferengi trader, bartender and occasional criminal  (though he'd loudly protest that the latter were only a long series of 'misunderstandings' between himself and any number of local authorities). It's rumored he has a heart of latinum, but keeps it locked safely in a bank vault with the rest of his wealth.
Data_Character_Riker_description: The quintessential First Officer: unquestionably loyal, unfailingly brave, and always willing to put his crew ahead of himself. A rare officer who was content to serve rather than seek command.
Data_Character_Saru_description: Saru is a Kelpien, an alien species born with a unique ability to sense danger. The first of his kind to join Starfleet, his dedication and skill led him to become First Officer on the U.S.S. Discovery.
Data_Character_Scott_description: Chief Engineer of the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain Kirk and famous for (in no particular order) his genius, his love of whiskey, and his proud Celtic heritage.
Data_Character_Sela_description: A half-Romulan, half-Human hybrid. She has little but scorn for mankind, preferring the cool, sharp intellect and fierce passions of her father's people. Treachery is her forte.
Data_Character_Shinzon_description: A clone of Picard, created on Romulus with the intent of using him to spy on the Federation. Instead, Shinzon became a herald of his race's eventual downfall, helping to destroy the Romulan senate and plunge the planet into a brutal conflict.
Data_Character_Sisko_description: The Federation commander of station Deep Space Nine during the Dominion War. A proud leader and philosophical general, he is as comfortable ruminating on religion as he is creating revolutionary battle tactics.
Data_Character_Soji_description: Growing up, Soji believed she was a normal woman, working as an anthropologist in Romulan space. This was a lie.  She was an android, built from the same systems that once created Data.  Her life so far has been a lie, created by others.  Her future, though, remains in her hands.
Data_Character_Spock_description: Easily the most famed Vulcan in Starfleet history, Commander Spock is renowned for his logic, his thoughtfulness, and his firm friendship with Enterprise crewmates Captain Kirk and Dr. McCoy.
Data_Character_Stamets_description: A science officer, or more accurately an 'astromycologist' on board the U.S.S. Discovery. A genius, he helped design the revolutionary spore drive. A brusque but kind hearted man.
Data_Character_Sulu_description: The fearless helmsman of the U.S.S. Enterprise, tasked with piloting her on her epic five year mission. As Spock once said, despite his calm demeanor Sulu is, at heart, a swashbuckler.
Data_Character_Sutra_description: An android, one of a series built using Soong technology. Sutra is hostile to humans, seeing them as little more than outsiders who wish to destroy her and her kind.  She seeks an alliance with a race of god-like synthetics who's whispers have been heard across the Quadrant.
Data_Character_Tilly_description: An ensign aboard the U.S.S. Discovery. A theoretical engineer by training, Tilly is in turns shy, ambitious and always incredibly warm hearted. Those who push past her awkward exterior will have a friend for life.
Data_Character_Tomalak_description: A legendary Romulan commander, famed among his people for his cunning... and among his enemies for his treachery.
Data_Character_Torchbearer_description: Less an individual and more a klingon legend come to life; a ceremonial warrior who acts as champion and uniter of the 24 great houses in case of war or coming catastrophe. The Torchbearer always wore striking golden armor.
Data_Character_Torres_description: A half-Klingon, half-Human, former Maquis engineer. Pressed into service aboard the U.S.S. Voyager, she often struggles with her warring halves as she solves complex engineering problems with out-of-the-box solutions.
Data_Character_TPol_description: A Vulcan officer assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise NX-01 during the historic mission that introduced humankind to the stars. She is calm and thoughtful, with a core of steel that has served her shipmates well.
Data_Character_Troi_description: A half betazoid empath who served on the U.S.S.Enterprise under Captain Picard. A warm, friendly woman whose ability to understand her shipmates and psychological training makes her a perfect counselor.
Data_Character_Tuvok_description: The third in command of the U.S.S. Voyager and that vessel's head of security. While deadly in a fight, his true strength lies in his Vulcan upbringing; he is logical, thoughtful and always has a plan for every eventuality.
Data_Character_Uhura_description: Communications officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain Kirk. Her fluency in alien languages and calm under pressure make her an invaluable member of the crew.
Data_Character_Worf_description: In another era, Worf would have been an enemy of the Starfleet. Instead, this proud Klingon rose to become one of its greatest officers: a warrior, a diplomat and an indispensable member of the Enterprise crew.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_A: Adds an Assimilation stack to the target. If a target has 3 stacks of Assimilation, they lose 50% of their max HP.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_B: Places a Bomb on the target that will detonate the next time they take damage, or disappear after 3 turns. Damage dealt by a Bomb will use the Tech stat. Can be Cleansed.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_C: Remove a number of negative status effects from an ally based on the Cleansing Crew's Tech stat.
Trigger an attack when damaged by an enemy attack.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_D: Once per battle, revive with {0}% of max Health.
Affected Crew can't use Skills for the duration of the Skill Lock.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_E: An effect will trigger at the beginning of this Crew Member's turn.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_I: An effect will trigger when this Crew Member has {0}% of their maximum health remaining.
An effect will trigger when this Crew Member has {0} Morale.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_M: Gives points of Morale to the target.
Removes points of Morale from the target.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_P: An effect will trigger when a Crew receives certain statuses.
Remove a number of positive status effects from an enemy based on the Purging Crew's Tech stat.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_R: A portion of incoming damage will be dealt to the attacker.
Recover {0}% of current health each turn.
Data_Characters_EffectType_description_S: Cannot Cloak and Glancing Chance is 0%.
Shields block a limited amount of incoming damage and disappear when used up.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_bridge_expositio: Back aboard the Artemis, you explain your mission into the Nexus to Burnham and Worf...
So this energy ribbon ripped each of us from our own time period, and who knows how many othersâ€¦
The Enterprise has encountered the Nexus before. It seduces the minds of those it captures, making prisoners of them all.
Letâ€™s not delay any further. Captain, it would be wise to locate more displaced officers trapped here.
Your scans detect another life sign within the Nexus matching Starfleet records...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e1m1: After a successful leap into the Nexus, your crew begins to mysteriously disappear.
A lone soldier requests your help from an unknown location.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e1m2: It appears you arenâ€™t the only Starfleet visitor to the Nexus. Ripped from their own time, Burnham and Worf find themselves here as well.
Before you can all regroup, they must disable the Cardassian vessel and neutralize the threat it poses to the Artemis.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e1m3: Youâ€™ve tracked the distress signal to a nearby ice planet. Scans show a single Federation base located near the north pole.
All comm attempts have failed. You suspect the base has come under attack by Cardassian forces.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e1m4: The away team has successfully reached the Federation base, but a grim sight reveals that they may be too late.
Are all the crew stationed here dead? Do more Cardassians lie in wait?
Or is it something else entirely?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e1m5: The away team prepars to venture deeper into the Federation outpost, but they must remain wary of the AI controlling the base's defense.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e1m6: The away team must proceed to the heart of the complex.
There they will find Talos - an artificial intelligence designed to give Section 31 an edge in pursuing their secretive agenda.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e2m1: The U.S.S. Artemis is pulled to a new sphere within the Nexus, where you are greeted by Commander Spock of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Spock has an urgent request: help him find his missing captain, James T. Kirkâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e2m2: After finding Captain Kirkâ€™s empty shuttlecraft on a planet within the Nexus, the away team battled the Romulans who took Kirk captive. Now the race is on to save the captain from the Romulansâ€™ clutchesâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e2m3: The Artemis tracks the Romulan ship to a desert planet sparse with life. But one particularly dangerous species in particular.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e2m4: The away team continues to hunt for Captain Kirk on the Gorn planet, having surmised he's being transported to the base of someone known as the â€œNest Fatherâ€.
They must free Kirk without further escalating the situation.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e2m5: The away team joins Captain Kirk to put an end to the Gorn-Romulan alliance before it can set its nefarious plans in motionâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e2m6: An enraged Tomalak attacks the base from orbit, and invades, determined to kill Federation and Gorn alike.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e3m1: We find ourselves in orbit around a class H planet; dry and devastated by asteroids impact.
Our sensors have picked up what appears to be a repeating federation transmission â€“ a mayday.
I've ordered an away team led by officers Burnham, Saru and Worf down to the surface to locate the source.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e3m2: The distress signal has led the away team to the wreck of a Federation shuttle.
Hopefully we can find survivors and some clue as to what happened.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e3m3: With Gul Dukat in custody, the away team has begun to hunt for the shuttleâ€™s missing pilot.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e3m4: A combination of brute force and delicate engineering has allowed the away team to crack open the mysterious door.
Now perhaps we'll be able to both find Odo and begin to uncover the secrets of this mysterious planet.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e3m5: The away team has managed to navigate through the upper reaches of the Borg complex but communication has been lost.
Shields had been activated around the facility, rendering our attempts to lock onto them impossible.
Still, the away team consists of some of Starfleetâ€™s finest officers. If anyone can find Odo and escape - it's them.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e3m6: Our team has rescued Odo and is making their way back to the surface.
Unfortunately, with the shields still active, it's impossible to beam them to safety.
They'll need to find some way of shutting them down before the Borg appear in full force.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e4m1: The U.S.S. Artemis has received a broken communication from Dr. Crusher, requesting help to deal with a sickness spreading through an outpost.
With the sickness driving the infected insane, the away team is cautiously beaming down to forest clearing near the outpost.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e4m2: The away team advances to the Starfleet research outpost, with obvious signs of damage.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e4m3: Normal medicine is proving ineffective against the disease, the away team needs to aid Dr. Crusher in creating a cure.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e4m4: The U.S.S. Artemis has arrived at Lupix IV, a desert world. Planetary scans have discovered a Klingon structure.
The away team prepares to beam down, determined to find some answers and hopefully a cure.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e4m5: Arriving in orbit again, the away team prepares to beam down and deliver the cure.
However in their absence the number of infected has grown within in the outpost.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e4m6: The away team races to stop Khan from working with the parasites to seize control over the rest of the outpost.
It's a formidable alliance as his physiology renders him immune to the parasites.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e5m1: The nearest planet is identified as 'Xaxos 7', a minor body in the Neutral Zone - claimed by both the Federation and the Klingon Empire.
Before the Artemis can investigate further, the ship is hailed from the surface. It's Captain Janeway, and she needs your help!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e5m2: The Klingon forces on the planet claim they were attacked by a mysterious assailant.
In the ensuing fight they were shot down, but not before damaging their attacker.
It's possible that it crashed nearby and, if so, might have the answers you need to keep the peace between the Klingon and Federation outposts.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e5m3: Approximately 30 minutes ago sensors picked up a foreign body entering the planetâ€™s atmosphere. Magnetic fields rendered a precise reading impossible but initial scans indicated a 6-sided cube shape.
The Borg have arrived and begun to assimilate the planet. It's up to the Artemis and her crew to save those remaining on the surface.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e5m4: Seven of Nine has been rescued, but the Borg Cube still hangs over the planet.
Unless it's stopped, it's only a matter of time before a new wave of drones will arrive.
There must be a way to defeat such a relentless foe... but how?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e5m5: The Borg's initial attack on Xaxos 7 has been slowed by the actions of the away team. They had disabled the Cube's communication relay, preventing it from summoning additional hostiles.
The Cube itself, however, remains a serious threat.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e5m6: The away team had disabled the communication relay and dealt with the initial wave of drones.
Yet the Cube continues its course towards the Collective.
What force still controls the vessel, now that Locutus is defeated?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e6m1: The U.S.S. Artemis finds a lone Starfleet vessel, the U.S.S. Pioneer, adrift and unresponsive.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e6m2: The U.S.S. Pioneer's crew have succumbed to a form of madness that renders them confused and highly aggressive.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e6m3: Long-ranged scans have revealed a badly damaged Warbird tumbling through space: the I.K.S. Ning'Tao.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e6m4: Above the planet floats the Cardassian ship Martok warned you about. The Kornaire.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e6m5: Beaming down to the surface of the planet to find the source of this madness.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLog_e6m6: To boldly go where no one has gone before.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_captainsLogSuppl: Stranded on a hostile alien vessel, Commander Michael Burnham requests your support.
The away team has successfully disabled the Cardassian warp core. Aboard the U.S.S Artemis a new team assembles under your command.

The Cardassians forces are defeated and the last of them have fled. They donâ€™t seem aware theyâ€™re inside the Nexus. Are they creations of this place, rather than trapped in it like you and your crew?
Attempts to contact the Federation outpost have gone unanswered. What has happened inside the base?
The away team has proceeded into the complex and found a place that seems to be dead save for mysterious holograms in the form of Federation officers.
What happened here? What is Talos?
The away team has returned to Artemis after learning more about Talos â€“ an advanced AI, capable of fighting wars with holographic projections.
They must enter the core and disable Talos before it can harm anyone else.
Project Talos has been dealt with and the away team returned safely to the Artemis.
They've brought with them an alien device, a sphere that appears to be unlike anything else we've so far encountered.
A file they found in the base claimed the thing had 'cracked the sky open when it fell to earth.'
If true, I believe it's a key that will allow us to leave this part of the Nexus and move deeper into the dimension. What wonders might await us?
Captain Kirkâ€™s shuttlecraft has been shot down by the Romulans.
The away team returns to the Artemis for a reprieve, before tracking down Captain Kirk and his captors.
Sela beams away before the away team can stop her. Their only recourse is to return to the Artemis and track down the ship carrying Captain Kirk to an unknown fateâ€¦
The diplomatic summit has been interrupted, but Kirk is likely in the hands of the Gorn.
The away team must track him down before itâ€™s too lateâ€¦
The away team had located Captain Kirk. However, thereâ€™s still the matter of the Romulan-Gorn alliance to deal with.
The Artemis and the Enterprise remain in orbit, ready to lend assistance.
The Gorn reneges on the alliance with the Romulans.
A betrayed and furious Tomalak prepares to eliminate both the Gorn and the away team.
In flash of light, Kirk and the Gorn Planet suddenly disappear, and the away team find themselves back aboard the Artemis as it is pulled to another shard within the Nexusâ€¦
Our away team has found the source of the signal: a crashed federation shuttle.
But several Cardassian patrols seem to be operating in the area, hunting for someone they call the â€œCommanderâ€ or â€œGulâ€.
Someone who was on board the shuttle? We'll need to investigate further.
Gul Dukat has been recaptured and his allies routed, freeing us up to investigate the planet more thoroughly.
The question remains: what was the strange power he called on? A Pah Wraith? Or something even more sinister?
The away team hads successfully tracked Odo through a series of canyons and past a group of opportunistic Klingons.
Hopefully, the Changeling will be found safe and sound behind the mysterious door they've discovered.
The away team has penetrated into the heart of what appears to be an ancient Borg research facility.
Borg... I can't think of a more dangerous or implacable foe.
With luck the away team will be able to avoid them as they navigate the complex in search of the missing Odo.
But I fear with each step thousands of dormant Borg are more and more likely to wake up.
A garbled message from the away team comes as a relief.
They are alive and Odo has been rescued. Now they just need to escape.
The Borg complex has been destroyed and, more importantly, our ally Odo has been rescued. As we ready for departure, I find myself looking down at the planet we're leaving behind.
Innocuous from space, yet riddled with miles upon miles of steel corridors controlled by one of the Federationâ€™s most implacable foes.
Was this simply a creation of the Nexus, or does it mirror Borg complexes that exist outside, in our own universe?
Winding tunnels buried beneath the surface of planets throughout the quadrant lined with an infinite number of drones lying dormant... waiting to wake up?
The away team have not yet reached Dr. Crusher, but have the supplies vital to discovering a cure to the mysterious infection.
Reaching Dr. Crusher has given the away team hope, unfortunately the knowledge that this disease could be artificial is troubling.
Dr. Crusher has been stabilized but the sickness still infects the colony.
A clue in the blood of the infected points to an artificial origin, a mysterious drug that has origins on the planet Lupix V.
The U.S.S. Artemis races away Lupix IV with a cure for Dr. Crusher and the inhabitants of the outpost.
But also the dark knowledge that a human traitor is responsible for this catastrophe.
The parasites have been dealt with, but their master remains: Khan.
A conqueror from old earth, genetically engineered to be faster, stronger and more intelligent than any normal man.
No one in this Sphere is safe until he's found and stopped.
Khan and his plan have been stopped. But a new danger has emerged, equally interested in the secrets of the Nexus.
The away team found a crashed Bird-of-Prey and spoken to her crew.
They say they were shot down by what they assumed was a Federation ship.
Who did they fight? And what happened to this mysterious attacker?
The mysterious vessel has been revealed to be a Borg Probe.
One that's communicating with its mothershipâ€¦
A fully operational Borg Cube!
The Borg's plan to assimilate Seven of Nine and unlock the Federation defense codes has been dealt with.
But now they'll come in force. Itâ€™s going to take a miracle to stop them from assimilating Xaxos 7.
The away team has disabled the Cube's ability to connect to the Collective, preventing it from summoning reinforcements.
The away team had repelled the hostile forces within the Borg Cube, including Locutus.
Yet the Cube is already repairing and restoring, and something still controls the vessel and the drones in it.
Until the true leader of the Cube is defeated, the <span style="color:#FFCE00">Borg will not stop.
The Borg Queen has been defeated, and another Nexus Reactor acquried. What other nightmares await the crew in the Nexus?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m1_battle01_0: Thanks for responding to my distress call!
I don't know where I am or how I got here, but the locals aren't very friendly!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story01_02: Any sign of Starfleet crew out there?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story01_03: Not yet. Atmospheric ionization could be blocking a precise reading from our tricorders.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story01_04: We should prepare for battle. The Cardassians will NOT show mercy.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story02_01: These bodiesâ€¦ Their wounds donâ€™t look like they were caused by those Cardassian weapons.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story02_02: Commander Burnham of the U.S.S. Discovery hailing Federation outpost, please respond! I repeat, this is Commander Burnham...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story02_03: We must assume the worst. The Cardassians may have penetrated the facilityâ€™s defenses.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m3_story02_04: Letâ€™s regroup on the Artemis and plan our next move.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_battle01_0: Finally a friendly face! Can you tell us whatâ€™s happened here?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_battle01_p: These must be what the Cardassians were talking about. Their â€œghostsâ€.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_battle02_p: Tricorder scans indicate that these are definitely holograms, but I've never seen ones so sophisticated.
Holodecks have yet to be invented in your time, obviously.
These holograms appear to be some form of automated defense system.
They must be generated from somewhere deeper inside the base.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_battle03_0: Security breach in sector A-23. Searching for countermeasures... Stand by.
Response found. Experience indicates a 96.32% chance of successful removal of intruders.
I recognize her. It is Captain Janeway of the U.S.S. Voyager!
Let us hope this imitation is not as formidable as the Captain herself.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_battle03_p: Do you think Janeway was involved in this?
Impossible. Thereâ€™s something else at work here. Something nefariousâ€¦
We should regroup back on the ship. Burnham to Artemis, three to beam up.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_exploratio: Unknown personnel detected. Error. Memory circuit compromised.
Damned thing is going haywire. Looks like weâ€™ll have to find our own way in.
I suggest we cut through the door. It is the most direct approach.

Iâ€™ve also reactivated the baseâ€™s defense system. We should be somewhat protected if thereâ€™s any danger ahead.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_resource02: I have located a storage chest, but I am having difficulty opening it...  This mechanism is most aggravating.
Donâ€™t look at me. Iâ€™m a doctor, not a locksmith.
Let me take a look. I have a knack for this kind of thingâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_01: Iâ€™m accessing the complexâ€™s database. This is a research facility working on something named â€œProject Talosâ€.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_02: That would explain the â€œghostsâ€. These scientists must have been inspired by Talosian illusions. Iâ€™ve had first-hand experience with them. All too real.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_03: As in Talos IV? But travel to that planetâ€™s forbidden by Starfleet.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_08: Exposing the central logic circuits to various threat scenarios has increased its combat effectiveness by 72.3%.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_10: All systems are operating within 99.2% of normal parameters.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_11: My staff has expressed ethical concerns about subjecting such an advanced artificial intelligence to repeated traumatic combat scenarios.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m4_story01_12: I have to remind them that itâ€™s still a computer, not a human being, even considering our recent modifications. End recording.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_battle01_0: Deploying defensive countermeasures. Shields to full power.
Theyâ€™ve got a mobile force field emitter protecting them!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_battle02_0: Thank you for opening the doors. We lay claim to this base for the Cardassian Union!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_battle03_0: If this is a Starfleet program, it will be programmed to obey our orders.
Computer, this is Lieutenant Worf of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Cease all aggressive activity at once!
Command not accepted.  Primary protocol is protecting the central Core. Talos must survive.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_battle03_p: Continuing simulation N32-B. Experience indicates chance of Starfleet intruder survival at 0.007%.
All intruders must be terminated. Talos must survive.
Stop attacking us! Weâ€™re Starfleet officers! Even the Klingon!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_exploratio: We are near the central core. How should we proceed?
Looks like the left path leads to the medical bay. We might find some more bio-mimetic gel there.
Iâ€™ve found another terminal. The encryption is extremely secureâ€¦ I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™ll be able to hack it!

Choose which path to follow. Youâ€™ll be able to try different paths when you replay missions.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_01: Iâ€™ve found another terminal. The files have been partially deleted, but... this facility was run by Section 31!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_03: Section 31 is a clandestine group within Starfleet. Theyâ€™re prepared to do anything to protect the Federation.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_04: This base was testing a new form of tactical computer.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_05: They discovered an experimental processor, capable of granting the device a more... humanâ€¦ response.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_06: Hrm. That sounds suspiciously like an "emotion chip". It can have... unpredicatable results.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_07: They were trying to use it to predict the behavior of biological life forms, creating a machine that knows how we think...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story01_09: But what about the researchers that were here? Where are they now?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story02_01: Iâ€™ve found another personnel log. Stand by...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story02_02: Chief scientistâ€™s personal log. Thanks to the new processor, weâ€™re making extraordinary progress!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story02_03: Weâ€™ve programmed Talos to create more realistic and unpredictable holograms.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story02_04: But there have been concerns that the sheer amount of energy required has begun to destabilize some of the secondary systems.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story02_06: Such disruptions are well within the range of acceptable stress parameters. Our work together will proceed as planned.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m5_story02_08: Sounds like this â€œTalosâ€ has a mind of its own...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_battle01_0: Weâ€™re almost at the core. Be careful!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_battle02_0: Hostile entities encountered. Upgrading threat level to epsilon-orange. Generating defensive measures.
You just had to go and irritate the damn thing...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_battle03_0: Hostile entities have accessed Core. Threat level at maximum. Searching files for counter. Searching... Searching...
Designation: Tactician required. Expert leadership required. Searching Starfleet files, sub-category: Commander.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_battle03_p: Error. System compromised. Purging excess energy. Defenses will reactivate in 572 seconds.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_exploratio: This machine is responsible for the death of everyone involved in its creation. Itâ€™s too dangerous. Weâ€™ve got to destroy it!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story01_02: Emergency log. Talos is no longer following our commands.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story01_03: A mysterious power surge in the core has Talos is stuck in a feedback loop.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story03_01: The system is coming back online. Here goes nothing...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story03_02: System online. Identifying Starfleet personnel. Welcome to Talos Base, Doctor McCoy.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story03_04: Weâ€™ll disable the distress call. Youâ€™ll be left alone for a long time, Talos.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story03_05: System diagnostic in progress. Searching for new directives... Thank you for your assistance.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e1_m6_story04_05: Intriguing. The energy pouring out of it appears similar to the ribbon in space that trapped us here in the Nexus.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m1_battle03_0: Stop! This is as far as you go.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m1_battle03_p: Well... sounds like he's alive, at least.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m2_battle01_0: You fools run blindly toward your deaths!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m2_battle02_0: Weâ€™ll need to subdue these Romulans before they warn Sela of our approach!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m2_story01_02: Sela! You bring dishonor to the name of Tasha Yar.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_battle01_0: You wouldnâ€™t have met one yet, but Jim Kirk did. Theyâ€™re called the Gorn.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_battle01_p: Not expressly, but as a Klingon warrior, one has a knack forâ€¦ reading between the lines.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_battle03_0: Commander Tomalak has ordered you eliminated, Federation pests.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_battle05_p: Do you think this is over?
My warbird waits in orbit. I'll return and blast you to atoms!
Dramatic fellow. He's right out of one of those Old Earth serials Sulu loves so muchâ€¦
Spock to Artemis away team. Weâ€™ve been following the situation from here.
With Tomalakâ€™s defeat, weâ€™ve been able to intercept Romulan transmissions indicating where the Gorn are holding Captain Kirk.
I will send you the coordinates. It is imperative we reach the Captain before it is too late.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_exploratio: I have found a piece of Romulan technology. It seems to be the source of the transmissions.
I might be able to access it and replay more of their communications.
Iâ€™m picking up Gorn life-signs over that ridge. They might lead us to Jim.
Weâ€™re through. Itâ€™ll take a few minutes to route the data stream to my PADD.
More Gorn just over there. We should try to ambush them.
An excellent tactical decision. For a doctor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_01: I'm picking up a Romulan transmission originating nearby
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_02: It must be the unit escorting Captain Kirk
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_03: Maybe... let me see if I can intercept the signal.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_04: ... proceed to the designated location. We look forward to meeting with your ambassador in person.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_05: Be wary ofâ€¦ pests that may interfere with our meeting. Tomalak out.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_06: That is Tomalak, a Romulan Commander. My Enterprise has had several encounters with him.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story01_07: He is duplicitous, and will stop at nothing to meet his goal.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story02_01: Commander Tomalak, the meeting with the Gorn delegates commences as planned.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story02_02: Are we really forging an alliance with these brutes?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story02_03: My dear sub-commander, you shouldnâ€™t be unkind to our hosts.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story02_04: After all, they will be on the front line when we expand into Federation space.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story02_05: Brilliant, Commander. What of the Federation spies weâ€™ve detected?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story02_06: Dispose of them quietly. They must not interfere with our meeting.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_01: Just aheadâ€¦ Keep your voices down. There's something happening.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_02: â€œSomethingâ€ is right. I see Romulans AND Gorn.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_03: ...weâ€™ve made good on our promise to deliver Kirk. Now... Do we have your support?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_04: <The Nest Father appreciates your gift as he approaches the great shedding.>
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_05: Itâ€™s using a translator device. Iâ€™m surprised the Gorn have a tool meant for diplomacy.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_06: <The One known as Kirk is on his way to the Nest Father's base. But...>
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_07: <Before we speak furtherâ€¦ I assume the Federation troops stalking behind those rocks aren't your alliesâ€¦>
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m3_story03_08: My apologies. We will see to this intrusion.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_battle05_0: So the Gorn brought you here as well? Youâ€™ll hand over your equipment, or weâ€™ll take it from you.
Weâ€™re hardly prisoners. Weâ€™re here for my friend!
First one to bring down the Klingon gets his bat'leth!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_battle06_0: These are the Gorn I gave the slip. Cunning devils. Letâ€™s take them by surprise!
What, no makeshift dynamite this time?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_battle06_p: Enterprise to Captain Kirk. I am glad to see you are well, Captain.
Spock! Itâ€™s good to hear your voice. But weâ€™re not leaving yet. The Gorn and Romulans are planning something.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_exploratio: What on earth happened to them?
It's Jim! Jim happened to them.
We should scan the area to see which way he went.
One of the Gorn is still alive. Perhaps he will have knowledge of Captain Kirk.
Iâ€™m no herpetologist, Mr. Worf, but maybe thereâ€™s something I can do for him.
I've found signs that he was here barely an hour ago.
Well, itâ€™s minor miracle. Looks like heâ€™ll pull through.
Heâ€™s pointing east! That might be the direction the Captain escaped to.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story01_01: Captain Kirk must be nearby. But among these rocks... it's like finding a needle in the proverbial haystack.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story01_02: Can you try tracking his communicator? He might have managed to hide it when he was captured.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_02: Bones! Iâ€™ve never been happier to see you!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_03: But what on earth are you doing here? Who are your friends?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_04: Commander Burnham of the U.S.S. Discovery. Itâ€™s a pleasure, Captain.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_05: And I am Lieutenant Worf of the Enterprise. It's an honor, Captain. I studied your exploits at the Academy. They were most impressive.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_06: The U.S.S. Discovery? A Klingon... on the Enterprise?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_07: An Enterprise from the future, Jim. Wherever we ended up has scrambled the timeline.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_08: That would explain Romulans and the Gorn working together. Follow me, weâ€™ve got work to do!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_09: Well, he sure looks like the real deal. Worf, what do you say? Tell me thatâ€™s Jim over there!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_10: Iâ€™m afraid not, Doctor. It is another one of the Nexusâ€™ creations.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m4_story02_11: But I believe we should follow him. Let us see how this plays out.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_battle03_0: Those are Romulans ahead. They must be part of the delegation.
Letâ€™s end this alliance before it gets started!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_battle04_0: Keep pushing! We must be close to the center of the base.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_battle07_0: Why are you doing this? I let you live!
<Before you, Human-Kirk, I was unbeaten. A champion of my people.>
<Until you bested me. For all my strength and might, I tasted defeat for the first time, and at the hands of a lesser species.>
You think I cheated you. Unfairly robbed you of your prestige
<Cheated? No, Human-Kirk. You won with ingenuity and bravery. The only worthy opponent I had ever faced.>
<Now come. Letâ€™s see us see if you can do so again.>
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_battle07_p: <You are as I wished. A great final opponent, Human-Kirk.>
You... hit just as hard as I remember. If I hadn't had help...

<Allies? No. They are an untrustworthy people. Their only purpose for us was as fodder in a war against the Federation.>

<Human-Kirk, you taught me what all the duels on my homeworld could not: sometimes your wits are the greatest weapon.>
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_exploratio: More Gorn guards. This must be where the Nest Father is waiting.
They will not block our way for long!
Wait. Take it from me, Gorn donâ€™t go down as easy as you think.
Bones? Thoughts?

<You are wise not to think you could best himâ€¦ or usâ€¦in combat. You may proceed.>

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_01: So... Captain. Any idea why does this Gorn â€œFather of Nestsâ€ want you so badly?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_02: I wasn't sure at first, until they referred to me as his â€œgreatest adversaryâ€...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_03: You mean it's the same one you fought after the Cestus III attack?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_04: Itâ€™s the only Gorn Iâ€™ve ever met. As Spock would say, itâ€™sâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_07: Thatâ€™s the one. The Gorn attacked it, but before we could defeat them the Gorn Captain and I were taken by a powerful race called the Metrons.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_08: They stuck the two of us on a desolate world and had us fight it out for their amusement. I won, barely. Spared the Gornâ€™s life.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_10: Well, we didnâ€™t part on the best of termsâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_11: Captain, itâ€™s possible that all of these enemies may just be creations of this dimension weâ€™re trapped in.... this â€œNexusâ€.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story01_12: Well, they certainly hit hard enough to be real. And I certainly feel real. Can we really take the chance theyâ€™re not?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_01: I am most disappointed, Nest Father. I thought our people had found common ground.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_04: You were a legend to my people. But often legends are full of lies.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_05: I will give you one more chance, Nest Father. Ally yourselves with me, or be destroyed.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_06: <Your empty threats betray your cowardice. You are unworthy of an alliance.>
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_07: Please, take your time to think it over. After all, once youâ€™ve been eliminated, perhaps your people will choose a more... amenable leader.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_08: You have one Romulan hour. I look forward to your surrender.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m5_story03_09: That doesnâ€™t give us much time. Weâ€™ve got to prepare for the Romulan assault!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_battle01_0: Romulans are beaming down. Weâ€™ll have to deal with them first!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_battle03_0: Kill them all! A bar of latinum to the first trooper to bring one of them down.
A single bar? I'm not sure whether to be flattered or offended...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_battle04_0: Over there! The Commander wants none of them left alive!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_battle06_0: Must I do everything myself? If my troops can't kill the lot of you, Iâ€™ll gladly finish the job!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_battle06_p: Nest Father! Iâ€™m glad to see youâ€™ve pulled through. I hope this time we can depart on more friendly terms.
<Yes. Leave with my blessing. I can depart for the Great Shedding with pride.>
<I am dying, Human-Kirk. Rotting away from a disease that blackens the scale and renders our blood toxic.>
<Forgive me for capturing you but... I wished to die like a warrior. Not like a hatchling, cowering by its egg.>
Black scale... That sounds like Patheorix. A saurid disease. The Federation cured that twenty years ago!
With any luck, I can resequence the gene therapy involved so it might work for your species!
<There is... a cure? You and your kind are wonders, Human-Kirk. You would make much better allies than the Romulans, I think.>
<Here. Take this as a token of my gratitude. And perhaps a new era between our people.>
<My soldiers found it recently. Some artifact they claimed lay deep in the sand, so hot that it turned everything around it to glass. Odd, isn't it?>
Odd doesnâ€™t begin to describe. This artifact is similar to the one that powered Talos. This cannot be a coincidence.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_exploratio: I hear something down that corridor. Sounds like more headed this way!

Or we can force these bulkhead doors closed to buy some time!
Hurry! Thereâ€™s almost on us!
Hrgghhhhh...

<Ah, Human-ally-of-Kirk. It looks like my fighting days are over.>

They must have beamed it in when the attack began.

Thatâ€¦ works.
Perhaps we might be able to use this to our advantage. If we can adjust the transmission codeâ€¦

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story01_01: Your leader failed to honor the terms of our agreement. We do not tolerate betrayal!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story01_02: The Artemis is detecting weapons powering up on the Romulan Warbird in orbit!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story01_04: Aye, Captain. Moving the Enterprise to intercept the Romulan vessel.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story01_05: Weâ€™ll stay behind and help get the Gorn to safety.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story01_06: I suggest the Artemisâ€™ away team head to the nearest transporter pad while we engage the Romulans.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story02_01: Spock to Captain Kirk. Sir, we have neutralized the Romulan warbird. Are you and Dr. McCoy ready to beam back aboard the Enterprise?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story02_02: And that looks like our cue to beam out as well. What do you say, Bones, are you ready to head for home...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story02_03: Iâ€™m sorry, Jim. My place is with Burnham and Worf. You seeâ€¦ You arenâ€™t even real, my friend.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story02_04: What do you mean Iâ€™m not rea--

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e2_m6_story02_07: No - this is coming from.. Somewhere else. The signature appears to resemble some sort of wormhole.... And itâ€™s forming right on top of us!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m1_battle01_0: Starfleet scum! You thought you could kidnap the great Gul Dukat?

Iâ€™ll take your word for it. The shipâ€™s picking up a long-range mayday transmissionâ€¦ Federation by the sound of it.
Look over there, towards those hillsâ€¦ Thereâ€™s some sort of device half-buried in the sand. Could it be coming from that?
No, but scans show massive amounts of energy contained inside that thing; enough to knock a starship out of orbit!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m1_story01_01: Ahead of us! A crashed Starfleet shuttle!

Ah! *growls*Now the Cardassian presence here makes sense. They're attempting to rescue their Commander!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m2_battle08_0: Will your kind never learn?! I will not be caged!

But thatâ€¦ thingâ€¦ might be the exception to the rule.

Looks like a makeshift shelter, maybe Dukatâ€™s?

â€¦the shuttle crashed in a valley with only two obvious exits. We know Dukat went one way. My best guess is Odo went the other.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m3_story01_01: Stop! It's another one of the alien devices.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m3_story01_02: This one is more active than the other. Scans reveal heavier shielding, and energy pulsing out across nearby rocks.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m3_story01_03: We should steer clear of it. Finding Odo is our priority.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m3_story01_04: Letâ€™s look for a path around it.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m4_battle01_0: Ahead of us â€“ a Borg drone!

Well, when you put it that wayâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m4_battle01_p: Odd. This Borg drone seemed far less functional than others I've encountered.
Who knows how long itâ€™s been trapped in here?
Yes, it has fallen into disrepair. Although these walls do resemble the interior of the speciesâ€™ ships.
The complex is silent. Only a few of the mechanisms here seem to be working properly, if powered at all.
Letâ€™s find Odo before heâ€™s â€“ what did you call it? â€œAssimilatedâ€?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m4_battle02_0: Up ahead! Are thoseâ€¦ Starfleet crew?

Theyâ€™ve spotted us. And they donâ€™t look friendly!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m4_battle02_p: Similar, but no. Perhaps they are part of a Borg experimentâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m4_battle06_0: Over there! That door must be important. It's heavily guarded.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e3_m4_exploratio: Careful! There's some sort of flooding here.
Scans show high amounts of dimethyl cadmium, hexavalent chromium and a mix of other toxic ingredients.
Not a cocktail you want to drink.
Time is short. We can simply wade across.
I can give you a hypospray to prepare you, but donâ€™t blame me for the hangover.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_exploratio: Hmmm... This might be a problem. I can't see an obvious way forward.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story01_01: Away team to Dr. Crusher. The medical supplies are secured.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story03_01: It is good to see you, Doctor.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story03_04: Well now I feel old. Flattered, but old!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story03_06: We're dealing with a pathogen that seems to have a near 100% rate of infection.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story03_07: 100%?!  That's impossible... I assume you tried standard antibiotics? What about retrovirals?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story03_08: Yes. It doesn't seem to respond to...

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story04_01: Iâ€™ve been experimenting with the Theragen compound you brought back.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story04_04: I canâ€™t be certain, but there are certain biomarkers in their blood stream in common with Klingon ribosomes.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story04_05: Iâ€™ll continue my research and try to...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m2_story04_06: ...Iâ€™m sorry, Iâ€™m just feeling a bit faint.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_battle01_0: Ugh... I'm having problems focusing on this equipment... I...

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_battle11_0: This isnâ€™t the time for a linguistics class. Itâ€™s the time to act!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story01_01: Doctor Crusher, any way we can complete synthesizing the cure?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story01_02: Youâ€™ll need more... Theragen... Thereâ€™s a path through the forest... You should be able to avoid some of the infected.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story01_03: Thatâ€™s enough, Beverly. You need your rest.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story02_01: Iâ€™ve been through all of the Doctorâ€™s notes. Theyâ€™re incredible. Her scans of the nucleotides of-

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story02_04: Her breathing is easing. Whatever you did, itâ€™s working.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story02_05: Hmm... Sheâ€™s a fighter, but so is this damn illness.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story02_06: Now that's odd. Her research noted that the pathogen seemed to resemble betatephlin.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m3_story02_08: Betatephlin is a drug. As far as I remember, it's only produced on a single planet... Lupix IV.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_battle01_0: Burnham to Artemis. Weâ€™ve made it to the planetâ€™s surface and weâ€™re under attack by Klingons!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_battle01_p: We must press on. Finding a cure for the infection is of the utmost importance, even if it means we must battle more of my people.
Youâ€™re worried about Doctor Crusher, arenâ€™t you Worf?

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_battle12_0: Stop them before they destroy the equipment!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_battle12_p: I believe the scientist escaped in the confusion. Should we follow and attempt to apprehend her?

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_battle14_0: Stay away from those plants! The scientist has ordered them protected!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_battle14_p: Over here. This must be the plant the guards were talking about. A cure perhaps?

Odd, seems to be genetically manipulated to... Oh. To deal with parasites.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_exploratio: Over there! A pair of guards. Hmph. They look a bit too trigger happy for my liking.

...We must get in somehow.

QaleghneS! I am Worf, son of Mogh. You will allow us to enter this facility.

Well... Someone say something!

...For god's sake. Not this again.
...Odd. She seems to be attracted to him yet isn't throwing sharp objects. How... un-Klingon of her.

They're right behind us!
We need to hold them off. This looks to be where they're manufacturing the drug they've used on the colony.
With luck we can find something here that we can use towards the cure.
With this sample, Iâ€™ll be able to synthesize a cure. Weâ€™ve got to get back to Doctor Crusher!
Burnham to Artemis. Weâ€™re ready to beam out!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_story01_01: I shouldn't give my research to you, but you are... very convincing.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_story01_02: The â€œvirusâ€ we created is merely a modified form of the drug betatephlin, re-engineered to act as a carrier for a biological lifeform.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_story01_03: What's driving your colleagues â€œmadâ€ isn't a disease. It's a parasite.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_story01_04: Fortunately, we created a cure - a drug that affects the creatures and renders them dormant.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_story01_05: I'll never forget you. Perhaps... If we'd met in another century... When our kind wasnâ€™t at war.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m4_story01_06: Burnham to Artemis. We have the cure and weâ€™re ready to beam out!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_battle01_0: Ahog ot ymg'? Ymg''ll ah'mglw'nafh geb!
Well, I don't know what he's saying but I sure as hell donâ€™t like it!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_battle01_p: Did you hear the tone in his voice for a moment? Intelligent. Sharp. It wasn't just random noises. He was speaking.
Those bugs inside him are maturing and reaching adulthood.
Unless we release this antidote, it might be too late to save the hosts.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_battle07_0: The traitor must have made allies of them after betraying the Klingons. Who better than Romulans, the inventors of the cloaking device?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_exploratio: Where do we head to next?
We need to proceed to the filtration unit. The longer we wait, the worse this is going to get.
Eh? There's an injured man lying here. We can't leave him! We've got enough spare antidote to get him back on his feet.
I appreciate your Hippocratic oath, Doctor, but we cannot afford to waste time.
If you really want to put that to good use, Doctor Crusherâ€™s laboratory is nearby. Reviving her could be vital for dealing with this crisis.
Bah. You definitely share Spockâ€™s affection for cold logic.
One moment, Doctor. I don't like this. It's quiet. Too quiet.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_01: I've double checked the information. This is simply astounding.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_02: It appears whoever this traitor was, he gave the Klingons a delivery system for a parasitic entity - one that quickly matures into a fully-grown and intelligent form.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_03: I came to that conclusion. Damndest thing I've ever seen. Makes me all... itchy just thinking about it.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_04: Luckily, I've been able to reverse engineer the toxin based on the Klingon research.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_05: While it previously acted as a stimulant, it will now act as a sedative.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_06: ...slowing their growth and rendering the creatures dormant. Great work, Doctor!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story01_07: The final step would be to release the compound to the air and force the creatures into a dormant state. We wouldn't want to kill an intelligent species, after all!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story02_01: Over here! Here's the first of the air filters.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story02_02: With luck, we'll be able to use it to disperse the cure throughout the compound.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story02_03: Luck? Hard science, my friend. These connect to every vent in the complex.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story02_04: Once the hosts begin to breathe this in, the gas should put them and the parasites out like a light.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story02_05: Allowing us to extract them and save whomever they've infected.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story03_02: My... head. It feels like somethingâ€™s squirming inside...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story03_03: Well, hold still. The cure we worked on should fix you right up.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story03_04: Ahh. That's better. I can feel the results working already. You're a miracle worker, doctor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story03_05: And to think Jim always complains about my bedside manner!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_01: We've done it! The compound should be flooded with gas shortly.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_02: Ah, members of the Federation. Come to stop the spread of my friends.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_03: So, you must be the human the Klingons spoke of?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_04: A means to an end. Dogs, if you will. Barking whenever their master commands.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_05: Dogs?! You dare call a Klingon a dog?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_06: It seems an apt comparison. Klingons. Romulans. Humans. All so easy to manipulate and infect.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_07: Why, do you know the Klingons thought I was a human? The Romulans as well.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_09: Hardly, Doctor McCoy. Don't you recognize your former patient?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m5_story04_11: Don't you recognize KHAN NOONIEN SINGH?!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_battle10_0: So... my Federation friends. At last we meet face-to-face.
Khan. Only someone as arrogant as you would attempt to manipulate three entire races.
You do me an injustice, Doctor. My goal was simply to provide  the parasites with new homes. Surely a medic such as yourself can appreciate that.
The weak are often work horses for their superiors. Your Federation should understand that by now.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_battle10_p: In more ways than one. All that strength, that raw power...
AND he had one of the Reactors. Every time weâ€™ve shifted into a new reality, itâ€™s like theyâ€™ve been placed in our path. We need to figure out why....
I donâ€™t want to alarm anyone butâ€¦ is it me, or is the room getting darker?
Youâ€™re right, Doctor! Something is happening!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_battle11_0: ...apting translation modulation to match species X455 and X478.  Colloquial terminology â€˜Humanâ€™ and â€˜Klingonâ€™.
I donâ€™t believe thatâ€™s Khan, anymore.
Collapse of Reality Sphere imminent. Surrender the Reactor to me. Know that your sacrifice will be honored.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_battle11_p: Iâ€™ve scanned his body. We can investigate whatever that was once weâ€™re back on the Artemis.
I suggest we hurry. Thisâ€¦ â€œReality Sphereâ€ - as that thing called it - could collapse at any moment!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_exploratio: He'll be past these doors... We might be able to use our phasers to cut through them, but it will be VERY time consuming.
And would eliminate any chance we have to surprise him. There's got to be another way in.
Thereâ€™s an unconscious officer in the corner...
Ah, an emergency door for the occupants of the bunker to escape through. Sort of obvious, now that I think about it.
One must always secure a path to retreat, Doctor.
Retreat? I thought you Klingons didn't believe in the concept.  All... 'death before dishonor' and all that.
You've obviously never tried to woo a Klingon woman before. Retreat is... Occasionally advisable.
There goes any hope of not attracting attention...
Another filtration unit. Doctor, you wouldn't happen to have any more of the antidote with you?
Oh, I'm sure I could whip up the last batch. Just for old timesâ€™ sake.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_01: Ah, and here you are. I... don't know most of you. Some of you though I do recognize.  Hello, Doctor McCoy.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_02: Perhaps now you're wishing you had finished me off when I was in your
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_03: I'm a doctor, not an executioner. Can't help but wish someone had knocked some damn sense into you, though!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_04: Alas. Farewell, Doctor. I doubt we will speak again.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_05: Did you notice the thing in his hand?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_06: A Reactor. That means another gatewayâ€¦ and those creatures canâ€™t be far behind.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_07: Well... when we find Khan, we should just ask for it nicely. Iâ€™m sure heâ€™ll give it to us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_08: We need to confront him, but he's sealed himself in the heart of the complex, deep inside the bunker. We need to get into it somehow.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e4_m6_story01_09: Hmmm... Beaming in won't work. Those things are shielded to prevent direct access.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_battle01_0: Hang on. I get the feeling we're being watched.
You are. Come to finish your dirty work?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_battle01_p: What do you think they meant? 'Our dirty work?'
Perhaps they blame us for the failure of their ship?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_battle03_0: Ahead. More scouts. I thought this was meant to be neutral territory.
Indeed. It looks like we're not the only group hunting for the ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_battle08_0: Starfleet conspirators! Stop them before they threaten the craft!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_battle08_p: Unlikely. My guess is that they're the crew of the fallen ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_exploratio: Wait. There's something toxic in the air.
My tricorder's picking up unusual amounts of ammonia and carbon monoxide. Whatever those mushrooms are spewing out is deadly.
We need to find another way through.
Let's backtrack - there's probably a better route through all these trees.
Bah. I do not fear a little poison. It canâ€™t be worse than a night spent drinking Chech'tluth!
Iâ€™ll take your word for it.
Medi-gel that should reduce the effects of the gas... ah. There we go!
Stop right there.
Great... there's a welcoming party.
Welcoming? Unlikely, after you shot our ship down!
Us? We're just here to offer assistance. The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? We were on a routine patrol when we encountered one of your vessels moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
Well, it wasn't us.
If not you... who?
That's what we'd like to know. Stand down and we can figure this out together.
She speaks the truth. After all, do you believe a Federation vessel would really be able to down a Bird-of-Prey so easily?
Hmmm... You make a good point.
I've got a bad feeling about this.
Bad feeling? Are you planning something, human? Maybe attack us while we're injured?
Wait... no! We're just trying to...
Bah. We can question them once they're subdued.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_01: I appreciate your response. I had no idea a Federation ship was in the neighborhood.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_02: Have you been trapped here in the Nexus like us?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_03: Iâ€™m not sure I follow youâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_04: Burnham, it appears this Janeway and her crew are creations of the Nexus. But they are no doubt our best chance to locate the next reactor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_05: Whatâ€™s the situation on the ground?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_06: We have a potential powder keg between us and the Klingon forces on this planet.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_07: Xaxos 7 is a designated neutral territory, claimed by both sides. Both maintain small outposts on the surface but each rarely comes into contact with one another.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_08: The Klingons avoid us, we avoid them, and peace prevails. Until recently, at least. Voyager answered a distress call from the Federation outpost here.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_09: Our probes picked up what appeared to be a Klingon ship approaching the colony . Before we could hail them, it exploded and crashed in neutral territory.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_10: You can understand the sensitive nature of this. We want to know what happened and, if possible, offer assistance.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_11: For all we know this was the prelude to an attack.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_12: Can't you just beam over to the crash site?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_13: As your ship's scanners have probably noticed, any attempt to beam seems distorted by the unique magnetic field of the planet.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story01_14: Fair enough. If we want to investigate the crash, we'll have to do it on foot.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story02_01: Over there! Is that the ship?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story02_02: It'd have to be a pretty small ship if it was. I think it's just debris, nothing more.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story02_03: Definitely Klingon in design. Hmmm... from the looks of it, it appears to be part of a Bird-of-Prey. It must have broken off when the vessel was descending.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story02_04: Then we're close. And judging from the way the ground is torn up, the ship must have been falling towards the east. C'mon.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story03_01: So, what happened here? The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story03_02: Malfunction!? Hardly. We were on a routine patrol when we encountered a vessel moving through the upper atmosphere.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story03_03: Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story03_05: Of course, boy. We fought back hard enough to bring them down as well, but not before they knocked us out of the sky.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story03_06: Until now I assumed it was the Federation breaking the truce. But... if I'm wrong...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m1_story03_07: Then there's someone else on the planet. Someone hostile to you... and most likely us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle01_0: Huh... Federation. You're a long way from home.
Cardassians! Although, from the looks of it, not ones allied with their Empire.
Mercenaries! Looks like Janeway's intel about groups of bandits operating on the planet was accurate.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle05_0: These are Klingons alright. And looks like they're under attack from mercenaries!
From the Federation? Bah... It shames me, but we will accept your help.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle06_0: Hold your ground! Use any cover you can and don't let them draw you out!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle08_0: I could have sworn I heard voices near here.
Fan out... It could be either the Federation or Klingons.
Hold your position... steady... steady.... Now!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle10_0: This must be the mercenaries' main camp.
If we move quickly, weâ€™ll be able to get the drop on them!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle12_0: WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE.
Just as friendly as the ones we met before, eh?
But they seem more... animated! The other ones were decaying.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_battle12_p: Is that sphere the source of the message?
Yes. Now that I know its origin I can attempt to decode itâ€¦
PLANETARY SPHERE IDENTIFIED. RESISTANCE, MINIMAL. CHANCE OF ASSIMILATION 99.988999%.
Unfortunately, not. If I'm right, something's been replying to the device. And those replies have been getting faster and faster. Almost as if...
A Borg ship is on its way here!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_exploratio: Okay... I'm completely lost. All I see is trees, trees and more trees.
Well... we're obviously... huh. Okay. Even the path has vanished.
Is the signal still broadcasting?
Yes. Right through that mass of foliage. I'm not sure there's a direct route to it though.
Nothing a few phasers blasts can't solve.
Just aim carefully. The last thing we want to do is start a fire!
We could probably just use phasers to cut through the trees.
And risk starting a fire? Let's backtrack. There's got to be an easier way through.
More of that alien debris ahead.
And more of those mercenaries! It looks like they've set up camp nearby and plan to seize whatever crashed near here.
More patrols could be here at any moment.
You're right. We should hunker down here and get ready for any attack
We need to find a way of dealing with the mercenaries.
No, first we need to heal the injured.
No one's bleeding out while I'm here.
More mercenaries could be here at any moment.
Let's head them off before they arrive. If we can find a good spot near the clearing, we can get the jump on them.
The longer we sit around talking, the more of an advantage these dogs have. I say we take the fight to them now.
Bones? Aren't you going to argue with him?
