Me? God no. These thugs are a menace. The sooner we deal with them the better!
I KNEW I'd seen that alien tech before. It's Borg!
So that thing over there, that half buried sphere...
Is a Borg Probe. And where one goes, more will follow.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story01_01: Can our ship scan the surface and see anything?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story01_02: The Artemis is reporting that the magnetic field surrounding Xaxos 7 is still rendering most long-range scans useless.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story01_03: Still... we might have more luck running a localized scan. Hmmm....
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story01_04: Well don't keep us in suspense. Anything?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story01_05: Just background noise... chatter from the Federation base... huh. Several mercenary broadcasts coming out of the planet's wastelands.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story01_08: Maybe? I'm picking up what sounds like a repeating set of numbers, trillions of digits broadcasting incredibly quickly. This could be them!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story02_02: No, it's not the same. It's not Klingon wreckage. It looks... odd. Sharper, somehow. This must be from whatever the Klingons fought.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story02_03: It's too damaged to make out much, but you're right. It's definitely not Federation.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story02_04: Cardassian maybe? The mercenaries operating in this region might have a ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story02_05: No. I've seen enough of their vessels to know this is something else. And that worries me.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m2_story02_06: C'mon. The signal is stronger here, so we're moving in the right direction.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_battle01_0: Their ship's the size of an Earth city. I knew they were advanced but... I had no idea they were this powerful.
RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
And so loud! C'mon, we need to find Seven of Nine before these things overwhelm us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_battle11_0: Help... me. Help... THE COLLECTIVE REQUIRES YOU REJOI... they're eating awayâ€¦ at my mindâ€¦ YOU WILL BE REASSIMILATED INTO SERVE UNIMATRIX ZERO ONEâ€¦
They've begun the re-assimilation. If we don't stop it immediately, they'll harvest everything she knows and crack the base open like an egg!
Well, what are we waiting for?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_battle11_p: My... thanks. For a moment I could feel my thoughts slipping awayâ€¦
Yes. But also... tempting. There is a certain... peace in the Collective, Doctor.
Well, you'll have to stick with our little collective for now, Seven.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_exploratio: This is insane. We need to get out of here!
Stop being a coward. The Federation defenses are down and they're all busy fighting these robots.
We'll never get a better chance to loot their tech than now.
... ... are they trying to steal from the base while the Borg are invading? Really?!
Follow me. We'll run them off before they can do any real damage.
We don't have time for this. C'mon. We can deal with them later.
So... ready to fight us properly, eh?
What's wrong with you?
... what?
See that above us? That's the real threat!
They don't care who's fighting who down here. They plan on assimilating us all.
Federation, Klingon, mercenaries like yourselves... it makes no difference to these monsters.
You want to die? Fine. Stay and keep looting.
But if you want to live, either help or run off home!
Damnit. This way's blocked.
A security protocol must be in effect. It will have sealed all the entrances to repel any invaders.
Unfortunately, it's keeping us out as well. Solutions, gentlemen?
I suspect the codes locking the door are similar to ones I've used before on the Enterprise.
Give me a moment and I should be able to bypass them.
Let's just burn the lock out.
A very... Klingon solution, Doctor. I didn't know you had it in you.
I've been around Kirk long enough to know sometimes the best way forward is the direct approach.
Nothing? Let's backtrack.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story01_01: ... can anyone hea.... me? *crackle* Under attack!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story01_03: We need help immediately! A Borg Cube has appeared overhead. We're fighting back but drones are already assimilating hundreds here.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story01_04: Worse, we've lost communications with Seven of Nine. She has access to all the base's defensive codes!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story01_05: If they've re-assimilated her, the Borg will be able to use that knowledge to crack us open like an egg!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story01_06: Focus on saving as many of your troops as you can. We'll find her!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story02_02: Good to see you once more. I was worried we'd lost you when communications went down.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story02_03: Here and ready to help, ma'am. What do you need?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story02_04: Let's get these civilians beamed up to that fancy ship of yours.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story02_05: You and I... we need to rescue Seven of Nine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story02_07: Her comm signals just ahead but her vitals are going crazy. I think the Borg have her.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m3_story02_08: Then we need to get to her quickly. C'mon!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_battle01_0: I will never get used to these Borg structures.
We must find our bearings and eliminate these drones!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_battle03_0: STOP. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. ASSIMILATION IS CERTAIN.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_battle07_0: I'm picking up a significant number of energy signatures ahead of us.
Almost certainly. Judging by their positions, it appears to be a group gathered in some sort of defensive formation.
Defensive or not - we need to get through.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_battle13_0: Hmm, I can see some of the damage Seven of Nine mentioned.
Theyâ€™re pretty far along in the repair and restoring their ability to connect to the Collective.
INTRUDER DETECTED IN RELAY STATION 677-BX3. COUNTER MEASURES DEPLOYING.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_battle13_p: That's the last of the Drones.
Hardly, there surely are more on the way. We must disable the relay before they arrive.
And stopping them from calling over their buddies.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_exploratio: Take a look at this device here. Stands out, donâ€™t you think?
Good eye, Doctor. This appears to be a data distribution node. There's a flood of information flowing through it.
Anything we can use to our advantage?
This is definitely curious.
The suspense is killing me?
We learned the Borg are a part of a hive-mind, meaning all their Cubes are interconnected
This Cube has been damaged and disconnected from the Collective at some point. Theyâ€™re attempting to establish contact.
Meaning our window of opportunity is closing fast!
I think I can use this to relay a signal to the drones aboard the Cube that will prevent them from attacking us.
I expect the anomaly I created will be repaired soon, but this buys us some time.
Ahead of us are those recharging stations weâ€™ve encountered before butâ€¦
...Far more functional. Are they awake?
They're in statis while they connect to the collective.
Ugh... I feel like weâ€™re at the center of a hornetâ€™s nest. One move and the entire thing will swarm.
I suggest a swift attack.
Attack? You're crazy, man. They'll tear us apart.
I suspect their arousal wonâ€™t be so rapid, giving us a significant advantage.
If thatâ€™s a recharging station, it needs power toâ€¦ well, recharge, right?
I follow. There may be means of powering them down. An intriguing suggestion, Doctor.
Ugh... donâ€™t say it like that. You sound just like your brother.
We need to retreat. If we raise an alarm, we'll never get further into this vessel.
This looks like another one of those data-majigs.
I could see what we could do with this oneâ€¦
We should press on, playing around with the thing could bring the entire Collective down on our heads.
Iâ€™m going to give it a good phaser blast? Perhaps that will disrupt communications within the Cube.
I should be able to manipulate it so the drones donâ€™t react to our presence.
Can we DE-charge the Re-charge?
Disable them so the drones in stasis donâ€™t wake up on us? I believe I can.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_02: Of course. I only regret that you had to suffer at their hands.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_04: While I was linked once again to the collective, I saw the breadth of their plans for this planet.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_05: Despite their overwhelming power, the Cube we're fighting is merely a scout ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_06: If we fail in destroying it, we risk it alerting the others.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_07: Yeah, we donâ€™t need any more guests at this party.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_08: They'll use Xaxos 7 as a beachhead and devastate the quadrant.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story01_09: The Cube is too heavily shielded for us to attack directly. Our best approach would be to disable the Cube from within.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_01: Hold on. I recognize this device.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_02: Oh? Well don't keep us in suspense, man.  What is it?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_03: I believe this is a I data distribution node; an access directly into the Cubeâ€™s logs.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_04: Interesting. Letâ€™s seeâ€¦ Huh.  Thatâ€™s odd.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_06: Not exactly.  The Node has logs on hundreds of planets all assimilated like they're trying to do with this one.  Thenâ€¦ it looks like they encountered something that bit back.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_09: If I'm reading this right it means â€˜the Dreamlessâ€™.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_10: And after that, everything is scrambled.  All log entries and dates are corrupted and out of place. Measurements are wrong.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_11: Almost as if the laws of physics just collapsed all around them.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m4_story02_12: Great.  Another mysterious thing to worry about!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_battle05_0: SIGNAL DETECTED IN SECTION 6-XB6. INVESTIGATE AND ELIMINATE INTRUDERS.
More alarms. I think theyâ€™re onto us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_battle11_0: STAY WHERE YOU ARE. ASSIMILATION COMMENCING.
Well, we gave it one heck of a shot, but I think we may have really angered them this time.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_battle12_0: YOUR EFFORTS ARE FUTILE. ALL WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
This drone must be the Cube's commander.
That isnâ€™t a drone, isâ€¦ Jean-Luc Picard.
He was captured by the Borg once and assimilated, but we had rescued him! We brought him back!
Snap out of it, man! That's not your captain. Just some nightmare the Nexus has dreamt up.
THERE IS NO DREAMING IN THE COLLECTIVE. WE ARE NOT NIGHTMARES. WE ARE REALITY. SUBMIT.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_exploratio: Klingons are already here?!
More likely recent captives of the Borg. Notice the forcefield keeping them in place.
Less noticing, more captive freeing.
Hmmm... The shield appears to be operating on a modulating frequency.
Which would mean we canâ€™t disable it without knowing the pattern used in its activation.
Perhaps, but we can overload it by concentrating our phaser fire at one point.
Can we disable it?
Give me a moment, I might be able to bring it down temporarily.
That's going to be impossible to punch through without setting off an alarm.
I agree with your assessment. How about a power outage, though?
Interesting thought. Since the Borg Cube is already diverting power towards sections that require repair, maybe I can manipulate it into routing power away from the forcefield.
This place is a maze and its shielding is preventing us from beaming to safety.
I donâ€™t suppose they have a schematic of this place? You know, something they hand out to prospective buyers?
I can connect to one of the data distribution nodes and trace the circuitry it's connected to in order to create a rough layout of the Cube.
Let me see... This is so alien it is almost impossible to understand.
Can we get a general idea of where we are?
Scans show we're close to the center of the structure.
Let me see... This is so alien it's almost impossible to understand.
Can we at least get a general idea of where we are?
Scans show we're close to the center of the structure.
This relay is unlike any I've seen before. Whatever information is inside, Iâ€™d need hours to try and access it.
Hours we don't have. We'll have to hope we're heading in the right direction.
More captives. We must free them if this Cube is to be destroyed!
You think the same tactic will work again? Aren't these fellas constantly upgrading to adapt to threats?
Hopefully not that quickly, especially being cut off from the Collective.
Letâ€™s overload the forcefield with our phasers' fire.
Youâ€™ve shown a knack for making machines do your bidding, Michael.
I might be able to remodulate the field for a moment...
Iâ€™ll reroute power away from the forcefield.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story01_01: I'm getting a transmission from the Artemis. Reinforcements have arrived!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story01_02: What?! We just risked life and limb to stop that from happening!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story01_03: Not theirs, Doctor, ours! The Artemis is reporting waves of Federation and Klingon vessels exiting warp and attacking the cube.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story01_04: The onslaught is working. The Cube has left low orbit and is starting to retreat back into deep space.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story01_06: Indeed! I suggest we start our own retreat!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story02_01: Weâ€™re getting incoming communication from the Artemis.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story02_02: Theyâ€™re saying the Cube is badly damaged. It's rapidly retreating from the attacking fleet.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story02_03: I suspect the Cube is attempting to return to the Collective physically.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m5_story02_04: If they manage to do this, the Borg will know the location of the Xaxos 7 and her colonists. We canâ€™t let that happen.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_battle02_0: I believe the human phrase â€œthe more the merrierâ€.
Yeah, thatâ€™s not what itâ€™s about.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_battle05_0: Follow me! See if you can get past them.
I mean significantly less than the horde behind us. That'll do!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_battle11_p: This is a fully functional Cube. Perfect in form and function.
It is 27 kilometers of passages and rooms, contained within a precise geometric shape.
And within those are a complement of 178,456 active drones remaining.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_battle12_0: We've neutralized your drones. Stand down!
ALL IS BORG. YOU HAVE DEFEATED NOTHING MORE THAN STRANDS WITHIN THE GLORY THAT IS THE COLLECTIVE!
Okay... I think we made her angry.
YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. YOU WILL JOIN THE COLLECTIVE AND ALL WILL BE AT PEACE AND WELL!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_battle12_p: Despite her claims to being a mere part of a whole, I think her defeat is causing the Cube to power down.
And I'm picking up a signal from the Artemis! Theyâ€™re in range.
Let's grab that Reactor and beam out of here.
Not just yet. If we reroute the warp core's energy into a loop, we might be able to cripple the Cube... permanently.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_exploratio: Still you scurry around in the shadows, struggling against the inevitable.
I was hoping we'd be able to avoid detection for longer.
She's everywhere, every part of the circuitry around us. We need to keep moving.
To what end, â€œWorfâ€?
We like this one - this â€Worfâ€. Strong and able-bodied. You will make a fine addition to the Collective.
And your mind will reveal much about your race when you're assimilated.
For all her pride in being efficient and cold, sheâ€™s pretty fond of theatrics!
She has her drones surrounding us!
We have to keep going. If we retreat, she'll be able to pick us off in the tunnels.
You're a special kind of reckless, aren't you, man?
I, sir, am a Klingon!
Well, the two arenâ€™t mutually exclusive.
We have to keep going!
That's suicide! Back up. There's less of them behind us!
Major security here, and a forcefield up. No doubt this facility is of high importance.
Thereâ€™s a major energy reading beyond this barrier. It would be safe to assume itâ€™s the Cubeâ€™s warp core.
Have a look around. This ship is so modular, there might well be another entrance we've overlooked.
Hmmm... I don't see anything that resembles an energy modulator. It's impossible to ascertain where the barrierâ€™s generation point is.
We'll have to try further afield. If we can access a nearby node, we might be able to shut down all the power in the vicinity.
This must be the Cube's warp core!
It's magnificent... and terrifying.
Is it me or is that one of those Nexus Reactors that weâ€™ve been finding?
Youâ€™ve come upon more of these, â€œDoctor McCoyâ€? Iâ€™d be most interested to relieve you of their possession. This one has proven to be an energy source like no other.
The shield just went up behind us!
You don't think weâ€™d want you leaving, do you?
You've shown yourselves to be rare flesh forms. Creative, intelligent and determined.
And your â€œArtemisâ€ is running a technology that will be a fine addition to the Collective.
The hell it will!
More drones! We need to use a more robust approach.
Adjust your phaser frequencies. We need to overwhelm them before they can adapt.
Backs together. Don't let them flank us!
YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED!
More drones...
Well... perhaps today IS a good day to die!
Youâ€™ve been saying that a little too often...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_01: Well, arenâ€™t you a resourceful pest?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_02: Someone is transmitting on our comms. I can't block it.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_03: Your machines are already part of the Collective. Your bodies and minds will soon follow.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_04: You may already know, but it bears repeating that resistance is futile. You only need to submit and be fulfilled.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_05: Sounds like you don't know much about the Federation if you simply expect us to roll over on your command!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_06: Roll over, play dead. We are Borg. Your actions have only delayed the inevitable. When we return to the Collective you will be... *hiss*
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_07: I've managed to mask our signal for now.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_08: I had heard that voice before, or at least one like it.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story01_09: Itâ€™s now obvious why this Cube is still active. The drones will not rest until we remove their Queen...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_01: Thereâ€™s another one of those data nodes. Might be useful, if weâ€™ve got time to scan it, that is.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_02: Step aside, Doctor.  This shouldn't take too long.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_04: Again, the codeâ€™s corrupted like the one we found earlier.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_05: Some sort of virus perhaps? They are similar to synthetics in many waysâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_06: Thatâ€™sâ€¦ actually a fairly accurate description of what I'm looking at.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_07: Before the Cube was damaged, everything was normal. Afterwards, itâ€™s jumbled. At first I thought it was just numerology. Dates and distances.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_08: But now? Itâ€™s more than that.  The code has bits of random text everywhere. Alien languages unlike anything I've ever seen.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_09: If I didn't know better I'd say it was like the data had been overwritten by thousands of different voices.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_10: Given how these things harvest people, is that so surprising? Maybe their old personalities got free?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story02_11: Possibly, Doctor.  Itâ€™s justâ€¦ odd. Very odd. And in the Nexus that makes me uncomfortable!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story04_01: Thereâ€™s an opening in the wall here.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story04_02: Possibly a maintenance corridor thatâ€™s gone abandoned.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story04_03: Abandoned? The Borg don't strike me as the type who waste anything.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story04_04: Come, Doctor. Where is your sense of adventure?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story04_05: Back on the Artemis. However, I do have a hearty dollop of â€œI told you soâ€ ready to be served at a momentâ€™s notice.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story05_01: Here it is. Let me see if I can remodulate the input.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story05_02: Dimming lights are a good indication that you did it!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e5_m6_story05_03: Let's get to the warp core before the Queen sends more drones our way.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_battle01_0: Greetings. We're from the U.S.S. Artemis. Do you, ah, require assistance?
That doesn't sound like Federation Standardâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_battle01_p: Did either of you recognize the language they were speaking? The universal translator was unable to make sense of it.
You know, when I was studying medicine at the academy, we were shown a video of old Earth â€œasylumsâ€.
Barbaric places where society discarded people. I can't help but be reminded of them by these poor souls.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_battle03_0: Stay close! There's more of them ahead!
And they look even less friendly than the last lot.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_battle06_0: More infected. A lot more than weâ€™ve seen elsewhere!
Is it me or do they seem like they're clustered in this area?
Perhaps thereâ€™s something here they're drawn to?
I'm bringing up the schematics now. Thereâ€™s the Sickbayâ€¦ there may be survivors inside!
We won't know for sure unless we find a way to get past the Pioneerâ€™s crew!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_battle12_p: That turned out better than I'd thought.
Letâ€™s get back into the Sickbay.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_battle13_p: I can't believe we're still alive!
Fortune occasionally favors the bold, Doctor.
Indeed. Now, let's see who it is on the bed.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_exploratio: There's shielding stopping us going any further.
It looks like the ship is still partially powered.
Powered enough to put something in our path!
Perhaps we can access the shield mechanism from that control panel?
Good thinking, Mr. Worf. With a bit of luck, we'll have this down in no time.
Letâ€™s get moving. Standing exposed like this is making me nervous.
If you don't mind a bit of physical exercise, we might be able to bypass it by ducking into that jeffries tube.
That is aâ€¦ small tube.
Bend at the knees, Worf!
Perhaps we should look for a way around.
Agreed!
Someone is lying on the bed there!
He must be the one drawing the infected!
What should we do about them?.
I suggest engaging the stragglers then retreating to the corridor.
With luck, they'll follow us, and we'll be able to pick them off one by one, rather than facing down the entire mob.
And here I thought you Klingons never retreated.
Weâ€™re warriors, Doctor, not foolhardy idiots.
They're enthralled with that survivor. That gives us the element of surprise.
And the chance to be cannon fodder!
No time to argue, Doctor!
Well thatâ€™s convenient!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story01_01: Burnham to Artemis. We've successfully beamed aboard the Pioneer.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story01_02: Odd. The air smells stale... burnt? Phaser fire perhaps, but I see no obvious signs of a struggle.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story01_03: Maybe the ship was ambushed and boarded? It might explain where the crew is.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story01_04: Seems unlikely that a ship of this size could have been caught unaware, but we can't rule anything out.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story01_05: Wait! I swear I heard something clatter over there...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story02_01: Those people on the floor ahead. Doctor, are they...?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story02_02: Afraid so. Phaser burns on all of them.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story02_03: They might have tried to fight back against the infected crew.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story02_04: This is reminiscent of our time with Dr. Crusher... Come, letâ€™s look for survivors.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_01: Over there, on the wall. Is that... writing?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_02: Good eye, Doctor. I nearly missed it in the darkness.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_03: â€œMy eyes are not my ownâ€¦â€. I can't make out that particular word.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_04: â€œIn this valley of dying stars. Oh hollow. Oh emp-â€œ. It trails off into unintelligible drivelâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_06: I'm not sure they even knew what was happening to them. This illness seems to eat away at whomever is infected.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_07: Have you noticed a common thread in all our encounters in the Nexus?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_08: I was just thinking that, Michael.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_09: We keep meeting individuals â€“ even machines â€“ overcome by an outside influence.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_10: Yes. Infected, diseased, malfunctioning, assimilated. A coincidence?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story03_11: Or perhaps a pattern in all this Nexus chaosâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story04_01: It appears to be a Starfleet officer. Possibly the former Captain of this ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story04_02: Is he conscious, Doctor? Is he able to speak?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story04_03: Hold your horses. His life signs are stable, which is a good start.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story04_06: Woah there. Take it easy, man! You're with friends â€“ weâ€™re of the U.S.S. Artemis. Can you tell me your name?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m1_story04_07: I... I'm Benjamin Sisko. Acting Captain of the U.S.S. Pioneer.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_battle01_0: As far as I can tell, Captain Siskoâ€™s fine. Scans show no signs of physical or mental trauma.
Listen, Captain, we're here to help. Can you tell us what happened to you?
I... I'm not sure, Doctor. Everything feels blurry. Soft somehow.
I remember a gathering somewhere in space. Maybe some kind of reception? I was speaking to a Klingon, and then there was a commotion.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_battle02_0: That soundâ€¦ thatâ€™s what people on the ship sounded like as they were being infected!
It was terrible. I heard them crying out, then their voices turned low and guttural.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_battle08_0: The turbolift should be straight ahead.
Along with what looks like half of your crew! Theyâ€™re clustered around it.
We must get past them if we want to retake the bridge. Follow me!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_battle09_0: No! No! Stay back! Stayâ€¦ aghhhhhh!
Over there! Thatâ€™s my first officer!
My god. That poor devilâ€™s already been corrupted. This virus is unlike anything I've ever seen before!
We can try and treat her later, Doctor. For now, we need to stay alive!
On my left! Drive them away from the controls!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_battle10_0: The infected are everywhere! Look out!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_exploratio: Weâ€™re cornered inside the Sickbay. More of them will be coming.
You're right, Doctor. We need to keep moving.
Captain. Can you recall whether the bridge was compromised?
I... No. I remember it being evacuated. I'm sure it's locked down. If we can make it there, we should be safe.
More importantly, you mentioned attending a gathering somewhere when the outbreak began. If we can access the navigational logs, we might be able to find out where that was.
Just give me a moment. I might be able to gather some medical supplies.
Good thinking, Doctor. I suspect those will come in handy.
If the computer's still working, we might find out what's going on. Letâ€™s see if this part of the Nexus recognizes my credentials.
Computer, identification: McCoy, Dr. Leonard.
Identification: Leonard Horatio McCoy. Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise, NCC-1701.
Welcome aboard, Dr. McCoy. How may I be of service?
Anything useful in the files?
Apparently, the infection began three days ago and spread to most of the crew. Symptoms included odd behavior, confusion and terror.
Hmmm, now this is interesting. I tried finding out where the ship was infected. All I get is â€œclassifiedâ€.
Does this door here lead to the bridge?
To the crew's quarters. Perhaps more of my people have taken shelter in there!
Let's see if my old Enterprise security clearance will work hereâ€¦ Success!
That's odd. A security clearance shouldn't work between ships.
We'll have to explain some other time, but this is aâ€¦ uniqueâ€¦ environment.
more casualtiesâ€¦
This is devastating.
There is nothing we can do for them. We should gather supplies and leave.
Give me a moment. I should be able to disable the door mechanism.
More casualtiesâ€¦
This is devastating.
There is nothing we can do for them. We should gather supplies and leave.
Unfortunately, Captain, we don't have time to spare trying to get this open. Getting to the bridge takes priority.
You're right, of course. Follow me. The turbolift to the forward deck is this way.
They're retreating, but it looks like the controls have been damaged.
With the shields still up, the Artemis won't be able to beam us directly to the bridge.
Well, we're going to need a new plan. Suggestions?
While my memory is spotty, I can still remember the override.
With a bit of luck, I should be able to get the turbolift to work.
Excellent! Let's get out of here before we're surrounded.
If we can pry open the doors, we can climb directly to the bridge.
That isâ€¦ a lot of climbing.
This is why I always insist on everyone passing their regular physicals!
It's too badly damaged, but thereâ€™s another route to the bridge.
I should warn you. Be prepared for a lot of climbing...
Just when I thought this day couldn't get any better...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_01: I... I remember running down this corridor before.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_02: Do you recall what you were doing?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_03: I was... I was looking down at myself. I... I know that doesn't make any sense.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_04: It was as if I was outside my body, watching myself run. It was chaos, crew everywhere. People struggling and shouting.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_05: I was myself, and thenâ€¦ it was as if I was sharing my body with something else.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_06: I'm sorry you had to go through something so terrifying, Captain.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story01_07: Thank you, Doctor. Please, letâ€™s keep going.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_01: We should be safe to search through the logs now.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_02: Captain's Log. Stardat-... *crackle*. En route to the *crackle* system with the delegates.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_03: I'm confident my gift of Klingon bloodw- *crackle* will go down well with Ambassador Martok.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_04: There are not entries for 27 hours following that. And then thisâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_05: *crackle* -omething has gone wrong. Cardassians are gone. We're retreati- *crackle* -endezvous with Martok's Bird of Prey in the Kurtz system. I hope w-*crackle*
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_06: They're with us. It's inside the ship. Inside us. I think I might be infected. I see colors out of the corner of my eye.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_07: Strange colors. *crackle* Look alien in the mirror. I don't recognize my own fa- *crackle*
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m2_story02_08: And thatâ€™s all I could find. What happened to you out there, Captain?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_battle01_0: Klingons over there, on the starboard side!
They sound just like the crew of the Pioneer. Whatever they're saying, it's not Klingon.
I think Doctor McCoy was right earlier: thereâ€™s no pattern in their utterings that would suggest a cohesive language.
It's like they're as alien to each other as they are to us, struggling to communicate but not sure how.
Letâ€™s stop them killing each other, and then we can discuss the finer points of their dialect!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_battle02_0: It looks like we're not the first to make a stand here. This part of the ship is so damaged, it's a wonder there's anything left!
Concentrate your fire! They're shrugging off all but the heaviest of shots.
They've lost all sense of self-preservation! They're just charging straight towards us!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_battle12_0: Hah! I THOUGHT one of you sounded like a Klingon. Come in and join the battle!
I assume that means somethingâ€¦ inspirational?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_battle12_p: Well fought! I'd be a fool not to be grateful for your timely arrival.
The honor is ours, Captain. What had happened here?
I assume youâ€™re envoys from Captain Sisko's ship - the Pioneer?
No, but we found that ship in a similar condition to your own vessel. Can you tell us what had happened?
We were working to achieve a trade agreement between the Klingon, the Federation and the Cardassian Empire.
We'd convened in neutral space near Shanti 5. Things were... surprisingly agreeable. I found your Captain Sisko an amenable enough host, and our two delegations seemed to get on well enough.
Then the Cardassians arrived. And they brought that... presence with them.
Their delegation beamed aboard screaming! Within minutes, the infection spread across my ship!
If you really want answers, they await you in the Shanti system, on the wreckage of the Cardassian vessel.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_exploratio: We're officially lost.
A Klingon is never lost in a Bird of Prey, Doctor.
By all means, take the lead.
Er, left, I think? Y
You sure? You just hesitated.
There was no hesitation, Doctor! Left it is!
To the right. I believe. That should take us towards the bridge.
You have no idea where you're going, do you?
Letâ€™s humor Lt. Worf and proceed to the right.
Hold. Scans are detecting a breach in the corridor ahead.
Someone must have detonated something powerful enough to punch a hole right through the hull of the ship!
Well, this is a fine mess. I don't suppose anyoneâ€™s got an EV suit handy?
I can try and reroute power to the nearest energy module.
With a bit of luck, I can set up a shield over the area so we can pass safely.
I don't see any way to repair it. We will need to find another route around.
This must be the ship's Sickbay.
More bodies. How horrific.
Well, they didn't do much for these poor souls. What happened here, Doctor? Did they kill each other?
No. I'm not observing any apparent wounds or signs of weapon damage like we saw when we first beamed across.
My tricorder is showing each suffered massive cerebral trauma.
Whatever was inside them, their bodies couldn't handle the strain and collapsed.
This is getting more dire by the minute.
What does it say?
Let me see... It's notes from the ship's Doctor. She's desperate to treat her patients and is trying everything she can think of.
Then she goes on to say Anetrizine has failed as has... something called Tranoline?
Yes, I would have tried the same. What else?
Her final entry describes her suffering what she perceives to be exhaustion. She sees strange patterns and suddenly feels like her hands aren't her own. The log concludes after that..
So she was infectedâ€¦
Grab anything that may be of use. We must locate Martok.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_02: Whatever we do, we must proceed cautiously. I'm picking up damage throughout the ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_03: Serious damage... It looked like firefights broke out throughout the decks.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_04: And here I assumed it was just part of the decor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_05: Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_06: But heâ€™s rather well versed in it. Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_07: -is commander Martok. Can anyone hear me?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_08: This is Michael Burnham of the U.S.S. Artemis. We are standing by to aid you. Where are you?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_09: Starfleet? On my ship? Wanting to help me? Bah, the ancestors of my house will be cursing me from their graves!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_10: I'm holed up on the bridge. Come and find me before I regret accepting your hel- *crackle*
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story01_11: He cut off. Letâ€™s head to the bridge!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_01: *crackle* Can anyone hear me? You still with me, Federation whelp?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_02: I'm reading you. Martok. What's your status?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_03: Iâ€™m on the bridge. I'm safe for now, but those treacherous dogs have found me.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_04: Itâ€™s only a matter of time before they break in here!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_05: We're en route! Are you still able to fight?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_06: Bah... I'm a Klingon, boy. We're born abl- *crackle*
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story02_07: I've lost communications. We need to hurry!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story04_01: Can you hear me, Federation? They've breached the doors. Today IS a good day to die! *crackle*
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m3_story04_02: Captain? Captain?! We need to get in there immediately!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_battle01_0: Those Cardassian crew members are clearly possessed.
If Martok was right, this must be the source of the infection.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_battle02_0: The shields are holding most of them back.
We need to subdue them before the barrier collapses.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_battle07_0: There's more of them coming from every direction. If we don't do something, we'll be overrun!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_battle09_0: This must be the engine room.
Or what's left of it! We need to find a way to shut down the power before it destroys the ship!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_battle13_0: The Bridge should be right ahead of us.
Looks empty except for... is that Dukat?!
Itâ€™s Gul Dukat to you! Who are you and how dare you set foot on my ship!
Thatâ€™s Dukat, all right. A different Nexus version of him, but with the same delightful attitude.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_battle13_p: Seeing you're here, I assume you were directed by Sisko and Martok and know of the delegation.
We feared the negotiations were a prelude to an ambush. So we arrived first and scouted the nearby planet.
Let me guess: something went wrong?
How incredibly observant of you, human.
When our scouts returned from the surface of the planet, they babbled in a cacophony of languages, flailing their arms and staring with wild eyes.
Their ship wasâ€¦ damaged. Something on it spread through into the hull of the Kornaire.
This is turning into a wild goose chase. And I'm  guessing the goose is on the surface of that planetâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_exploratio: There are too many of them!
I've accessed the security system and raised shields within the groups of Cardassians.
Nice work. Now we can deal with a few of them at a time.
Normally, I'd be the first to recommend a slow, tactical approach, Mr. Worf, but today? With the core about to fail?
We need to get to the engine room promptly.
Well, a direct attack it is, then. What could possibly go wrong?
Theyâ€™ll overwhelm us. We need to retreat and find another route to the engine room!
Indeed. As Kahless once said, â€œOnly a fool fights in a burning house!â€
Critical failure imminent. Prepare for incineration.
High Command thanks you for your futile but heroic deaths. Long live the Empir- *crackle*
I believe that is the Cardassian anthem.
Catchy tune. We should hurry, if only to shut this thing up.
It'll be close, but I think we can disable the core before it collapses.
With the engine stabilized, we'll be able to gain direct access to the bridge.
We don't have time for anything fancy. Get ready to eject the warp core!
Now we just need to find a route through the damaged sections to the bridge. Hopefully, the information we're looking for will be there.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story01_01: The atmosphere seems breathable, but I'm not sure it will last.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story01_02: I'm reading structural damage across the entire ship.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story01_03: Similar to the damage inflicted by the crews on the other vessels?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story01_04: Oddly, no. This vessel has suffered damage on what appears to be a molecular level. Itâ€™s almost as if the entire ship is drifting apart!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story01_05: That may account for the spikes of radiation Iâ€™m reading across the ship; my guess is the erosion is causing the warp core to fail.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story01_06: We must get to the engine room and stabilize it somehow.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story02_02: And now the ship's yelling at us. Charming. Any idea what itâ€™s saying?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story02_03: Give the universal translator a moment to adjust.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m4_story02_04: Warp core critical failure imminent. All crew with security clearance proceed immediately to the officer shuttles for evacuation.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle01_0: Cardassians! It must be the remnants of their scouting team!
Stay back. We can't let them infect us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle06_0: Maybe members of the Klingon delegation? Some of them could have escaped the disaster in shuttles...
â€¦fled to the only nearby planetâ€¦
Out of the frying pan and into the fire!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle07_0: Oh, you have to be joking. Who else is on this planet?!
I suggest we don't stay long enough to find out, Doctor!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle10_0: I'm picking up something moving towards us.
Impossible to say. I'm reading 2... 3... multiple signatures, all converging on our location!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle10_p: Not to get ahead of myself, but I think we just found out what attacked the Cardassian away team!
They seemed to be trying to fuse with us somehow. This must be what caused the madness on the ships: these things.
We had assumed some sort of virus or infection was responsible, but we're clearly dealing with something else entirely.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle11_0: Wait. The energy signatures are spiking.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_battle11_p: We need to press on. Whatever caused this must be nearby.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m5_exploratio: Woah. That was... unusual.
That was odd. Is everyone all right?
That looks like a temporary camp just over there. Probably erected by the Cardassian landing.
We should reach it and investigate.
Althoughâ€¦ this is odd. I'm picking up a strong signal from the east, past those dunes.
Let's check out that camp first. If there are any Cardassian survivors, they might require our help.
As you wish, Doctor.
Is the signal youâ€™re detecting Cardassian?
It is highly abnormal. It seems to be a looping broadcast.
Left by the away team?
It seems unlikely. The signal is incredibly complicated and contains thousands of languages.
I'm picking up a smattering of Cardassian, yes, but also Klingon, English, Vulcan, and hundreds of others.
Well, don't keep us in suspense, what does it say?
It seems to be repeating â€œStructure under attack. Engineers required.â€
Perhaps itâ€™s under attack by the infected Cardassians? Letâ€™s see if we can offer them help!
This was the Cardassian camp, alright. Or what's left of it.
I'm not picking up any life signs. Whatever happened here was days ago.
Letâ€™s spread out.
Give me a moment. I might be able to access their computer. Itâ€™s badly deteriorated but I can figure it out.
*crackle* Despite our suspicions, there's no sign of either the Federation or Klingons anywhere on the surface.
Unlikely as it seems, perhaps they're genuinely planning to negotiate with us in good faith. *crackle*
Unlikely as it seems? Itâ€™s their distrust that got us into this in the first place!
*crackle* -eila claimed she heard voices last night. Whispering near odd struct- *crackle* -ever seen anything like them before. The metal is war- *crackle*.
Thereâ€™s a time delay after that. Then one more entry.
We're not rea- *crackle* The sky is hollo- *crackle*. I think of my wife, my three children. Do they even exis-*crackle*. Jythâ€™cak- *crackle*
Itâ€™s a dream. Itâ€™s a-*crackle* -ream. They made us! They mad- *crackle* -s all in their suns!
That was the last entry I could find.
Could it be that they have found out the truth about the Nexus? Is it possible they realized theyâ€™re just phantoms in a fading dream world?
Indeed, Doctor. Although, he said â€œthey made usâ€. Almost like heâ€™s gained insight into how the Nexus works. We assumed itâ€™s a natural phenomenon, but this might suggest otherwiseâ€¦
Think about it: the worlds we visit fade, but the Reactors we find in them continue to exist. What if they're part of a construct? The Nexus as a machineâ€¦
Odd. Almost all of them have their weapons still holstered. It looks like they just collapsed where they stood.
The possessing force overwhelmed them.
Watch my back. I'll check to see if they've left anything useful behind.
Have you ever seen anything like this before?
Never. This is eons beyond any recorded technology.
It looks a lot like the Reactors we've been finding.
We may be looking at the machine behind the Nexus. This could be the construct powering each of the realities we had been to.
The message from earlier said the construct is under attackâ€¦ so as the reality around this â€œconstructâ€ collapses, we're able to see the gears turningâ€¦
Exactly!
I'm picking up the same low energy signal we detected earlier, but I can't pinpoint a single source.
Structure und- *crackle* -ttack. Engineers required.
Possession of Reactors 459by5 to 459by10 indicate potential Enginee- *crackle* -ctive. Protocol demands immediate contact.
It appears to be identifying our Reactors! It thinks weâ€™re the â€œEngineersâ€.
Before we go studying the structures, we need to secure the perimeter. We don't know if we're alone or not.
Hmm. I'm picking up numerous footprints. Some Cardassian, some... not. We need to be on our guard.
More and more of the Nexus machinery.
Itâ€™s more significant in size than I first thought.
We may be close to figuring out the very nature of the Nexus! This could be the key to everything thatâ€™s going on here, and the destruction the Nexus rifts are causing outside of it too!
If you'll allow me, I'll take point.
We're not going to learn anything standing around twiddling our phasers.
You're right. Let's investigate.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle01_0: Energy spikes in front of us.
More of those things are rising out of the sand!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle03_p: *crackle* -roblem communicating. Sphere cohesion reduced to 22%. Memories spreading through the remnant are increasingly corrupt-*crackle*.
Advise extreme caution. Stable patterns overwritten. Viral failure permeating. *crackle*

The â€œmadnessâ€ weâ€™ve been seeing. It is a virus, but more akin to a systems virus. The very individuals in this â€œSphereâ€ weâ€™re in are being partially overwritten and corrupted as they come in contact with other corrupted elements.
So these things that are after us are the source of the corruption, and have started the chain reaction in this Sphere!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle04_p: We need to find a better way of dealing with these â€corruptorsâ€. Any more battles like that and we'll be overrun!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle14_0: Things are swarming like bees to honey.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle14_p: *crackle* -early out of time. Functions reduce- *crackle* -emise imminent.
There must be something we can do to help you.
It still identifies us as â€œEngineersâ€ because of the Reactors weâ€™re carrying.
Engineers must access Reality Engines at the hear- *crackle* -exus and repair ongoing damage.
Data indicates five Reactors in your possessi- *crackle* Take this Sphereâ€™s Reactor to gain *crackle* -ccess the Reality Engine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle15_0: Sphere cohesion at .03% Flee enginee- *crackle* -se the reacto- *crackle* -epair the Engiâ€¦ EEEEEEEEEEEEEE *crackle*
The signal just died. I fear itâ€™s been destroyed.
Thatâ€™s not all. This light around us â€“ the same when we were with Kirk and the Gorn! Somethingâ€™s appearing!
My name is... itâ€™s been long forgotten. When one spends enough time in this place, memories tend to... decay. And I've been in here for a very, VERY long time.
This machine referred to you as a â€œflawâ€.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle15_1: Did it? A dreary term from an even drearier machine. I am one of the Dreamless, the closest analogue in your language.
Now, I must demand the Reactor you're holding. I'd prefer you surrender it, but I won't hesitate to take it by force.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_battle15_p: Hmmm. You're more resilient than I first thought.
Wait. Why do you keep attacking us?
I did? I don't think so.
You did. You attacked us earlier when we were exploring anotherâ€¦ Sphere.
Ah. You must have encountered one of the others. There are quite a few of us.
What's your purpose here? Why are you attacking this Sphere?
Curious. For ones who have been able to travel the Nexus and appear free of its snare, you appear to have very limited understanding of what it is.
As we understand it, the Nexus was designed as a machine to provide its inhabitants an eternal state of utopia.
Yes. Eternal. An unceasing monotony that never changes or grows. It keeps you trapped and robs you of every last ounce of identity or free will.
And now you'reâ€¦ taking everyone down with you? Thatâ€™s insanity..
You have not existed here for as long as we have. You think the Nexus is some sort of sanctuary. But you'll learn soon enoughâ€¦
We need to get out of here. The Sphere is collapsing!
Artemis, away team to beam out. Immediately!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_exploratio: There's rubble everywhere. I can't tell if this is an actual path anymore.
Let's head left.
Let's press on. I'm sure that this leads deeper into the heart of the ruins.
Let's head right. The ruins seem in slightly better shape over there.
I had no concept of the scale or age of this place. That do-hickey mentioned trillions of souls resting inside the Nexus.
And if it's beginning to collapse, every one of them is at risk!
I suggest we start with a full analysis of this technology. Hopefully, it will provide more information on the workings of the Nexus.
My scans are inconclusive. This technology is infused with the same energy as the Reactors.
We've concluded that they're both part of the same machine. But what do you suppose their role is?
Could they be the core of each Sphere, while the machinery around the Reactor makes the reality manifest?
Analysis suggests the ruins and this communicator are made from the same alloy as the Reactors we've been collecting.
That stands to reason. If this place is a construct, these might be the building blocks holding it together.
If that's true, why are we seeing any of them?
I reviewed Captain Picard's logs back on the Artemis. We should be experiencing a vision of bliss, not seeing the machinery that operates it!
But the device we interacted with said there's something wrong. If this â€œflawâ€ it mentioned is spreading, the Nexus is beginning to fall apart!
And in the process, the curtain has been drawn. We're seeing the cogs behind the whole operation: first the Reactors, now the machinery.
And don't forget whatâ€™s happening outside the Nexus! Destructive rifts tearing through time and space â€“ pulling each of us in â€“ the reason the Artemis arrived here in the first place!
So with access to the Nexus machinery, we might be able to affect a repair.
As good a plan as any!
Whomever built all this, it must have been constructed millennia ago.
â€œMillenniaâ€ is an understatement.
Every spacefaring culture in the quadrant has mentioned the Nexus in their mythology.
No matter how old the race, the Nexus predates them.
And given the infrequent appearance of the rifts, and the sheer number of beings the Caretaker claimed are inside itâ€¦
â€¦The construction of this place might have begun eons ago.
Older than anything we've ever encountered beforeâ€¦
More of those things. An entire horde of them just standing there like watchdogs.
It's impossible to advance without them noticing us.
Let's head left. We might be able to circle around them if we keep our distance.
We stand on the verge of uncovering one of the greatest secrets in the known universe. We can't let them stop us!
I suggest we veer to the right. If we're lucky, we'll stay far enough away that they don't detect us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_01: The signal we tracked earlier is stronger here. I think itâ€™s communicating directly with us!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_02: Adapting to sub language x-345b. Time period Beta Epsilon 56. Region. Outer Spiral of Galaxy 5b67y. Colloquially known as â€œthe Milky Wayâ€.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_03: Query. Data shows possession of five Cores. Possession indicates potential Engineer capabilities.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_04: The Reactors? Yes! We've found five of them, like you say. Who are we speaking to?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_05: Caretaker 689b-epsilon. Charged with preservation and operation of Reality Engine and associ-*crackle* -pheres.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_07: You ar- *crackle* -ently in the Nexus, in Sphere Construct 789.341.b12.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_08: What do you mean by â€œSphereâ€?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_09: Spher- *crackle* -irtual realities constructed around the consciousness to ensure condition of bliss.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_10: I've lost contact. The signal seems to be deteriorating further.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_11: This is fascinating! The Nexus was constructed with the intent to create these â€œblissfulâ€ dream worlds we had heard about.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_12: So, where did it go wrong? Since we've set foot in the Nexus, itâ€™s all been doom and gloom.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story01_13: This whole â€œmachineâ€ appears to be breaking down. The realities weâ€™ve visited, the â€œmadnessâ€ in the crews we've come across â€“ it all must be part of it.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story02_01: *crackle* -pologies for error in communication. Sphere cohesion at 36% and falling.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story02_02: Where are we? What is this place?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story02_03: You are in - as species in your sector classify it - the Nexus.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story02_05: Of c-... c-... cours- *crackle* This dimension is a repository designed to eliminat- *crackle* -e trauma that connects all life.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story02_07: The Nexus eliminates pain, strife and death. Each consciousness that enters it is hosted within a dedicated Sphere, providing it eternal bliss.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story02_08: Itâ€™s describing heaven. An artificially-created heaven...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_01: Damage to this and nearby Spheres have impacted my abil- *crackle* -unction properly. Code decaying and affecting operation parameters.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_02: Whatâ€™s the source of this damage?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_03: A flaw within the Nexus caused the fatal collapse of a Sphere approximately 12,356 of your earth cycles ago.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_04: That flaw has now spread, corrupt- *crackle* -estroying 19% of all known spheres.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_05: Wait, didn't it say earlier each â€œconsciousnessâ€ that enters the Nexus is hosted in its own dedicated Sphere?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_06: What happened to all those poor souls?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_07: As of this moment, approximately 38,007,684,112 consciousnesses had been extinguished du- *crackle* -flaw.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_08: That is horrendous. What's this flaw?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story03_09: Itâ€™s no good. I've lost communication again.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e6_m6_story05_01: I've found some containers. They appear Cardassian in design.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_battle01_0: Ahead of us: the phantoms we had encountered before.
That must mean the Dreamless are already here. Are we too late?
This structure appears to be functioning still.
Disabling it would be an incredibly complicated task.
We must hold out hope that thereâ€™s still time.
Well, letâ€™s deal with these first.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_battle03_0: Theyâ€™re seeking us outâ€¦ The Dreamless must know we are here.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_battle12_0: You must be the humanoids encountered by my allies.
We understand you have motivations of your own, but you are fighting a losing battle. We have eons-worth of understanding the workings of the Nexus.
Destroying the Nexus is unconscionable. It will extinguish all these livesâ€¦ thousands of them? Millions?
Multitudes of lives that have ended long ago, as the universe dictates. They should not be trapped and suspended in someone elseâ€™s idea of utopia. We're not the monsters you make us out to be.
You claim to liberate all these lives from someone elseâ€™s machination, only to determine their fate yourselves?
We have no time to wax philosophical with you. Please remove yourselves or we will be forced to eliminate you!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_battle12_p: You are a resilient species, but youâ€™ve only bought yourselves a few hours. This Reality Engine will be disabled.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_exploratio: The way ahead appears to be shielded somehow. Iâ€™ve never seen anything like it.
Considering how advanced this technology is, I doubt our phasers are going to do more than tickle it. Could the Artemis beam us across?
Iâ€™d suggest we not use the Transporter any more than we must, given the overpowering energies in this space.
Yes, I prefer to avoid a Transporter accident that will have me spend my life as Mr. Worfâ€™s Siamese twin. Soâ€¦ suggestions?
The Reactorsâ€¦ they brought us here. Could they act as keys to progress further into the structure?
That may just work!
An excellent suggestion, Michael.
I would bet my bottom dollar thereâ€™s another way. Whatâ€™s another hour of slogging through these halls?
Interesting. This may be some sort of status chamber.
I'm picking up several containers inside. Could be supplies.
Milk and cookies left out for us â€œNexus Engineersâ€?
Doctor! That thought feels almost... sacrilegious.
Iâ€™m going to try to utilize the Reactors to gain entry.
I feel we should avoid using Reactors to open this sesame. We donâ€™t fully understand the technologyâ€¦
You have point. We wouldnâ€™t want to trigger any defenses.
More supplies on the platform up there.
I believe I might be able to leap to the platform.
Leap? Are you out of your Klingon mind? It's far too high!
Have faith, Doctor! I should be able to make the jump.
YOU have faith. All I need to have is medical training to deal with the broken bones resulting from your impending fall!
Think we can make it up there?
It is my professional opinion that we cannot and should not.
Not with that attitude, Doctor. Very well.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story01_01: This place brings to mind Klingon tales I heard as a youth. The halls of Sto-vo-kor, where warriors battle for all eternity.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story01_05: Speaking of whichâ€¦ A commotion down the way!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_01: This place is beyond anything Iâ€™ve ever seen.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_02: Is it awe I detect in your voice, Doctor?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_04: It reminds me of the Holodeck on my Enterprise. It creates rich realistic simulations.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_05: I wish the Discovery had that sort of facility! Was the experience similar to what weâ€™ve seen in the Spheres?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_06: No. Holodeck simulations were more akin to... fantasies. Many of them were amusing trifles.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_07: Itâ€™s uncommon for them to feel anything like the consuming realities weâ€™ve seen in the Spheres.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story02_08: That sounds like what the Dreamless would term the experience of the Nexus â€“ â€œconsumingâ€. They feel itâ€™s more akin to a prison than a fantasyâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_01: So do we just keep wandering these halls orâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_03: Behind you! Itâ€™s... I'm not sure what it is.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_04: We are designation â€X'ytakiiâ€, or â€The Caretakerâ€ in your language. Weâ€™re one of several prime AIs designed to control the functions of this Reality Engine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_05: Our scans show you possess six Reactors and seem determined to defend this structure. Is our assessment accurate?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_06: Well, we are trying to stop these so-called Dreamless from destabilizing the Nexus.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_07: That is the function of an â€œEngineerâ€. However, you were not trained as Engineers, and we are unable to provide you with authority and tools to repair the Reality Engine and repel the intruders.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_08: Well, we sure would like to do that, though.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_09: You may take the test required of any Engineer, but without the proper training, you are likely to fail.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_11: Then you will not be granted the corresponding status and will be unable to seal the Engine. And so, the construct and the Spheres it connects will fail in approximately 3.567 of your Terran hours.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m1_story04_12: Youâ€™re not giving us much of a choice then!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_battle01_0: Halt! You will not pass here, shapeshifting scum!
I don't think they're in the mood to listen, Doctor!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_battle07_0: Do you hear phaser fire ahead of us?
You're right. Over there! It looks like the Cardassians are fighting Starfleet officers!
I think we know better than believing these are actually Starfleet officers. More likely more shapeshifters.
Have a little faith in me, Mr. Worf. Olâ€™ â€œBonesâ€ McCoy knows what heâ€™s doing.
Their body language, the awkwardness with which they move.
I trust your analysis on this, Doctor. Let us proceed.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_exploratio: Starfleet officers, over here!
Hang on. You're safe now.
Weâ€™ll be exposed here. Letâ€™s see if we can get this runabout up and running.
What is it your kind says? â€œNo good deed goes unpunishedâ€. Die!
Youâ€™re shapeshifters! You know, the Cardassians have been looking all over for you!
Some of them look badly injured. We need to deal with their injuries before we do anything else!
You're very kind, medical person.
Thatâ€™s an odd thing to call a Doctorâ€¦
Arenâ€™t you clever! Exterminate them!
Youâ€™re shapeshifters! You know, the Cardassians have been looking all over for you!
Check around. There might be something in the runabout we can use to help them.
Good thinking. There are some supplies over here.
You Starfleet rats want to steal our stuff?!
â€Starfleet ratsâ€â€¦ Wait, arenâ€™t youâ€¦
Youâ€™re shapeshifters! You know, the Cardassians have been looking all over for you!
It looks like someone abandoned supplies over there. We could use a restock.
It couldn't hurt to take a quick look...
Get them!
Or... maybe it COULD hurt! It's a shapeshifter ambush!
So someone just abandoned valuable supplies in the middle of a path? Do we ever get that lucky?
The Doctor makes a good point.
Sometimes a trap is just too obvious...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_01: What is this? Are we inside a Sphere?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_02: You are still inside the Reality Engine, but it's within our parameters to create environments for you to be tested in.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_03: The Caretaker has taken the form of Captain Siskoâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_04: We don't have time for this nonsense, man! You just said lives were at stake!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_05: Correct. It is recommended you make haste.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_06: I recommend you make haste in explaining what we must do.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_07: In our study of your memories, we've found the species in your quadrant value certain traits that align with the role of an Engineer.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_08: The first of these is Faith, as demonstrated by your Captain Sisko.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_10: You misunderstand us. Faith not in an omnipresent entity, but in your goal and skills, as well as those of your fellow Engineers.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_11: It was faith in something greater that allowed the original Engineers to create this place, and so it became a prerequisite for any Engineer that follows.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_12: A portal awaits you somewhere in this arena - an exit to the next test.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story01_13: But be wary, nothing you see is what it seems. Only faith in your goal will see you to the end.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story02_02: We felt a certain curiosity as to how you are faring.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story02_03: Let me satisfy your curiosity: weâ€™re in the middle of a war between Cardassians and shapeshifters, and both sides are very trigger happy whenever they see us.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story02_04: An impossible situation, we agree. It appears the only way out is to turn back.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story02_05: Turn back? You obviously don't know much about Starfleet!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story04_01: That must be the portal the Caretaker mentioned.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story04_02: It is. You have exceeded our expectations with your performance.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story04_03: You pushed through an impossible situation to meet your goal and put your faith in your allyâ€™s skills.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story04_04: Such faith is admirable, but can also make an individual blind. However, you do not appear to be driven by greed or lust for power.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story04_05: So that's it? We've passed your test?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m2_story04_06: The first part, yes. There are more.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_battle01_0: Hold. Scans are showing movement up ahead. A lot of movement.
We are Borg. You will be assimilated. Resistance is futile.
Ugh, canâ€™t theyâ€¦ compute a new form of greeting?
Perhaps you could save the sarcasm for a less precarious moment, Doctor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_battle02_0: This area looks devoid of activity. It should be safe to proceed.
Wait, it's an ambush! I must have triggered the alarm back there!
You will be assimilated. Resistance is futile.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_battle04_0: Do you see that silhouette ahead of us?
You will be... Assimilated. Resistance is futile.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_battle04_p: Odd. Iâ€™m sure that was the Queen, but she didn't quite sound like the one we'd met before.
I donâ€™t know. Sounded like the Queenâ€™s Borgish to me!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_battle14_0: Welcome, all of you. So very far from home.
Another Borg Queen! Although this one sounds more... real.
Another? We are Borg. No more, no less. All bodies are mere extensions of our will.
Even yours. Isn't that right, Locutus?
Yes. You will be assimilated before the combined might of the collective.
Today, we fight for a larger, more precious collective, and you will not stand in our way!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_battle14_p: We made it! Now where's our trial, mister?
We are here. And we congratulate you on your determination.
Despite being offered respite from this place multiple times, you always chose to press on.
Are we safe now? Are the trials over?
You are out of harmâ€™s way for the moment, but two more trials await you.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_exploratio: Are we lost?
Are we ever not?
TouchÃ©, Michael.
Letâ€™s stop for a moment. I can try accessing this node and find us a route forward.
Any luck?
My tricorder is showing a path, but another signal appeared at the same time.
Should we be concerned?
Maybe not, it seems to have stopped.
I feel like weâ€™re better off wandering around blindly than poking inside their system.
That seems to irritate them!
There's a recharging alcove over there. An unusual one.
Scans are showing a considerable amount of energy passing through it.
It might connect to the Borg network. Worth investigating.
Iâ€™m overloading it using my tricorderâ€¦
Itâ€™s shifting. Looks like itâ€™s being raised?
Likely an automatic system thatâ€™s moving it away for repair.
Letâ€™s see whatâ€™s behind it before the system conveys a recharge station to take its place.
Let's leave it and avoid the possibility of being detected.
I concur.
I think some of the paneling here is looseâ€¦
Well spotted. We might be able to pry it open and see if anything is hidden there.
Got it!
You want to play mechanic when the stakes are this high?
The Doctor has a point. Letâ€™s move on.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story01_01: Where are we now? This looks like a Borg Cube.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story01_04: You appear to us now as Captain Janeway. Is there a reason for that?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story01_05: In your time, Captain Janeway was renowned for her legendary journey.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story01_06: Over seven long years, the Captain and her crew traveled from the far side of the Delta quadrant and returned to earth. Such determination.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story01_07: She is appropriate in representing your next trial: the Test of Will.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story01_08: The Caretaker vanishedâ€¦ A Borg Cube, a â€œTest of Willâ€. I suspect we're going to be fighting every inch of the way!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_01: I'm exhausted. I need to rest for a moment.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_02: You would do well to listen to the doctor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_03: Agh! Canâ€™t you materialize in front of us instead of behind for once?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_04: Our apologies. We are only attempting to provide advice.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_05: By our calculation, you have only been successful in exploring 0.00001% of the Borg Cube in your search for the portal.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_06: The Reality Engine will collapse soon, and if you are in here when that happens, you will perish.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_07: We can transport you to safety.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_08: If the Reality Engine fails, so do the Spheres and all who are inside them!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_09: We believe you underestimate the size of the Nexus. It is built upon many Engines.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_10: But each â€“ and this one â€“ is responsible for multitudes of Spheres, correct? And all connected Spheres will fail if we give up now.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_12: And the Nexus will deteriorate further, causing all the destructive rifts that are threatening our universe â€“ outside the Nexusâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_17: I'm impressed, Doctor. I thought you were exhausted a moment ago.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story02_18: I still am. But we're here to save lives, not complain about a little wear and tear along the way!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story04_01: Your delicate form appears to have been progressively weathering.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story04_02: We estimate you would not be able to endure much more of this. We recommend an immediate departure.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story04_03: Hah! Did Khaless abandon the hunt of his brother, Morath? No, he hunted him across mountain and through valley, for his honor and the honor of their father.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m3_story04_04: And so, shall we fight through this place and come out triumphant on the other side!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_battle01_0: Klingons ahead of us. A lot of them!
Can't you communicate with them, Worf? Tell them to stand down?
I donâ€™t need to be well-versed in Klingon to guess that didnâ€™t go over well.
They are... not open to negotiation.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_battle01_p: They're retreating. We're safe for now.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_battle04_0: So... the Federation has a Klingon pet...

Yeah! And now youâ€™ve gone and made him angry. You wouldnâ€™t like him when heâ€™s angry!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_battle09_p: I'm picking up hundreds more bio-readings converging on our position. We need to retreat!
Huh. I thought you'd be arguing for us to stay and fight.
As Khaless himself once said, "The wind does not respect a fool."
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_battle11_0: I'm detecting a mass of Klingon bio-signatures ahead.
They must have been put in our way to guard the Reactor Iâ€™m detecting.
Hu'tegh! And they're not alone. One of them is wearing the ceremonial armor of the Torchbearer.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_battle11_p: Weâ€™re right over the source of the signal. I can use my tricorder in conjunction with our Reactors to access it.
The device powering the reality weâ€™re in definitely isnâ€™t of the magnitude of the Reactors powering the Spheres. Which is good news!

I donâ€™t think we need to â€œwinâ€ it. Our goal has always been to find the portal. Yes, it had previously appeared when we â€œwonâ€, but in this caseâ€¦ why donâ€™t we just make it appear?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_exploratio: There! Injured crew members ahead of us!
I'll... hang back and let you deal with this. A Klingon showing up might escalate thingsâ€¦
Weâ€™re here to help! Are you all right?
I... yes. Barely. Who are you? I don't recognize your uniforms.
