Iâ€™ve locked on a reading akin to the Reactorsâ€™. Itâ€™s definitely not as considerable, so perhaps this reality isnâ€™t as major as an actual Sphere.
Letâ€™s give your Reactor theory a spin! Do you think you can â€œreprogramâ€ this door away?
Yes! I can use my tricorder in conjunction with our Reactorsâ€¦
Iâ€™m accessing the underlining structure of this â€œrealityâ€. Itâ€™s complex, butâ€¦ give me a few moments.
The door disappeared!
Incredible.
I need to be closer to the signal source to do anything showier than that, though.
We should not waste any time or potential Reactor power.
Mr. Worf, you are a fine warrior and loyal ally. But you, Sir, are no fun.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_01: Intriguing! We appear to be on a Federation vessel. Scans showing damage throughout several decks.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_03: I'm receiving several jumbled messages. It appears Klingons have boarded the ship and taken control of key areas.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_04: Iâ€™ve learned itâ€™s generally safer when Klingons keep their hands off Starfleet ships!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_07: And that is the nature of your test.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_09: This test echoes the values your friend possesses in abundance.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_10: Recklessness? Willingness to drag us all into some fool adventure?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_11: The test of Cunning lies before you. You have shown a willingness to believe in your goal and to persevere through all odds.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_12: But some obstacles cannot be beaten head on.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_13: Find the portal and the end of this trial.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story01_14: And he's gone. Helpful as ever.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_01: This seems impossible. Itâ€™s a regularâ€¦ itâ€™s the Kobayashi Maru!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_03: Exactly. I assume you've both taken it?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_04: I have. And, like every other cadet, failed it every time. I was furious when I found out it was a no-win scenario.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_05: Either you rescue the crew and cause a war with the Klingon empire or abandon them to die.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_06: This scenario, too, is designed for failure. My people wonâ€™t relent here. We wonâ€™t survive their onslaught, and if we leave, these people will perishâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_07: But here's the thing: in my time, Captain Kirk DID beat the Kobayashi Maru test. In good olâ€™ Jim fashion, heâ€¦ got creative: he snuck in before the test and reprogrammed the computer.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_08: So we should take a page out of Captain Kirkâ€™s book andâ€¦ cheat.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_09: But how? Thereâ€™s no computer we have access toâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_10: This reality likely works like the other Spheres. Thereâ€™s a Reactor or a similar device running it. We find it and change its programming.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_11: But weâ€™re not â€œEngineersâ€ yet. Weâ€™re unable to affect the Nexusâ€™ technology!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_12: Iâ€™m done waiting for authorization from a hologram. All of us have dealt with unknown, ultra-advanced alien technology before. It is par for the course!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story02_13: Iâ€™m tuning my tricorder to the Reactors already in our possession. Letâ€™s find whatever is controlling the Caretakerâ€™s little trial.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story03_01: And here you are at last, through a combination of faith, determination andâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story03_02: Yes yes, we know: cunning. Way ahead of you, Confucius.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story03_03: Correct, you have circumvented the directed path and have tapped into the Nexus itself. Although you will find that the more major constructs of it are not as easy to tamper with.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story03_05: No! No more trials! We have proven our abilities, and there is no time.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m4_story03_06: Regardless of your perception of readiness, the trials for an aspiring Engineer are a binary requirement. They must all be complete before you are able to engage the Reality Engine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_battle01_0: We mean you no harm, weâ€™re from the U.S.S. Art--
Apprehend them! Tomalak and Sela will have our hides if we let them reach the beacon!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_battle01_p: Doesnâ€™t seem like these Romulans are open to dialogue and reasonâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_battle06_p: I wish we could have resolved that differently.
She seemed certain the Federation is working against the Romulans.
Perhaps catching up to her commander will give more insight.
They certainly seem sure we're spying on them!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_battle09_p: I'm not sure stunning him is what the test was about...
He did say at times you must show the other side the strength of your convictions!
Well... I don't see a sign we failed, so I supposed you're right.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_exploratio: Stop right there.
We're not here to fight.
You're a Klingon. Of course you're here to fight.
Fella has a point.
Hmph.

Stand down. Let us walk away and we'll do the same.

You realize your copy could be altered.

Very well. But I will not stay to converse any further. Take the data.

Oh? You think you can stop me?
Our sensor beacon has evidence that elements within Section 31 have been spying on my people for over a decade.
Itâ€™s my duty to report this violation to the High Council!
And you're not going to listen to reason, are you?
Reason from your kind? Hardly. You are treacherous scum. Romulans have learned the Federation can't be trusted.
Thatâ€™s rich coming from you! If you won't listen to reason, you'll listen to a phaser!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story01_01: You stand on the precipice of the final trial.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story01_02: And you appear as my former captain, Jean-Luc Picard.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story01_03: He seemed appropriate for this test.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story01_04: Aside from belief, will and cunning, it was determined an Engineer requires another trait: the rare ability to unify the multitudes of minds required in such an epic endeavor as the creating of the Nexus.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story01_05: This was often done through dialogue and reason, but at times one must bend opposition in the name of the greater good.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story01_06: Find the portal to complete your trial.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story02_01: Ahead of us! It's the last portal!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story02_03: You have persevered through trial after trial; shown traits that allowed the original Engineers to build this wonder we stand in.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story02_04: You truly are worthy of mantle as Engineers.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story02_05: Are you seeing this? My tricorder is showing a flow of information pouring down into the Artemis' datacore.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story02_07: You will use this to help repair the Reality Engine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m5_story02_08: But first, you must purge it of the Dreamlessâ€™ presence.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_battle01_0: The Engine seems darker now, doesn't it?

Who knows how long weâ€™ve been engaged in the Caretakerâ€™s trials...

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_battle04_0: You have no hope of preventing us from toppling this machine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_battle10_0: We cannot allow you to go any further.
You must let us past. The lives of millions are at stake!
We understand your concern. We are trying to save them as well.
You are taking their fate into your own hands. Youâ€™re assuming a moral high ground where you have no right to do so.

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_battle12_0: And that must be the leader of the Dreamless.
The intrudersâ€¦ Relentless in your quest to stop us.
I saw a glimpse of who you once were. Before you ended up here.
You were a scholar, a parent. Surely, itâ€™s not in your nature to commit murder of this scale!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_battle12_p: Enough! You are fools to protect this place! It is a prison. An affront to the natural flow of the universe!

I hate to say it but... what DO we know about the Nexus? Have we done the right thing?
I know that we wonâ€™t let someone just flip the switch on all these lives. (they beam out back to the Artemis)
She has retreated from this Engine, but melding with its core has revealed a secret to her â€“ one we had hoped to hide away from the Dreamless
We have given you access to their next target. Please honor your duty as Engineers and make haste, before all is lost.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_exploratio: This console can direct the platform to one of the two exits.
So... we're stumbling blindly forward, huh?
What is it you told us Captain Kirk would say? â€œTo boldly goâ€?

Let's take the left-hand path.
Any particular reason?

Good enough for me!
We've been lucky so far, so Iâ€™m fine with either.
Fine. Thousands of years of evolution, crewing one of the most advanced vessels ever created, and we're relying on luck to save millions of lives.
So sure, I vote for the right-hand path. Why not.
You stand at the threshold of the Engineâ€™s core.
We began this journey with little idea of the Nexus or its nature.
Weâ€™ve come together as a crew, united despite being from different cultures, backgrounds and timelines!
I canâ€™t think of anyone Iâ€™d rather have by my side at this moment!
Now you got this old man all teary-eyed! Letâ€™s get in there and put a stop to this!
The great Khaless once said, â€œThe enemy may be so strong none can stand against them.â€
â€œYet we must, for I would rather die than know we failed to stand as warriors when it mattered.â€
Today we honor those words! Together we shall conquer all obstacles!
Well said, my friend!
You would have made quite a name for yourself coaching football back at the academy, Mr. Worf!
As much as Iâ€™d like to get this over and done with so I can get back to sickbay where I belong...

Letâ€™s at least scan the place first  and see what weâ€™re dealing with!
Sensible as ever, my friend!

Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story01_02: Oh, so we got the shiny title! What now?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story01_03: As we speak, the Dreamless have penetrated most of the Reality Engineâ€™s defenses.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story01_04: Information required to repair the Engine has been uploaded to your ship and can be accessed via the Reactors.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story01_05: Take them to the Engine's core to stabilize it and bring the systems back online.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story01_06: The self-proclaimed â€œDreamlessâ€ are zealots and will risk everything to stop you.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_01: The damage is extensive. Weâ€™re running out of time!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_02: We estimate catastrophic failure in less than 5 Terran minutes.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_03: At present, the primary Dreamless has nearly finished merging her consciousness into the Engine.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_05: This Engineâ€™s protocols are designed to prevent unauthorized access, but the Dreamless have been sabotaging the system and gathering its Reactors for a long time.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_06: If their leader is able to merge her consciousness with this Engine, sheâ€™ll be able to shut it down, and it wonâ€™t be long until she can extend her power to the rest of the Nexus.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_07: There must be something we can do to prevent that from happening!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_08: As an Engineer you can merge your consciousness into the Engine much the same way.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_09: Though, such a feat requires tremendous mental prowess.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_10: Michael, you are one of the most powerful people Iâ€™ve had the pleasure of standing beside!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_11: Not to mention youâ€™re the adopted sister of the best mindmelder Iâ€™ve ever known. Well, the only one.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_14: Iâ€¦ Itâ€™s working. I can feel the walls spreading out around me like my motherâ€™s arms. Everything is golden. Everything is so large. Iâ€¦ had no idea.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_15: I can feel someone else here. Huge. Taller than a mountain before me. Sheâ€™s so righteous. So angry. Her children, her mates - all gone. All dead so long ago.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_16: Sheâ€™s noticed me! Iâ€™m trying to evade her. I think sheâ€™s losing focus on the Engineâ€¦ sheâ€™s pursuing me.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_17: She ejected me out of the system! I could feel her exerting energy to do itâ€¦ it may have slowed her downâ€¦
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story02_18: You will not be able to access the Engine again from here. You must arrive at its core.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_01: We must warn you that the process is almost complete. You have virtually run out of time.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_02: No! Let me try to access the Engine again using the Reactor.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_03: Are you sure? The last time your bio-readings were off the charts. If you do it again...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_04: Then Iâ€™ll have the best doctor in Starfleet looking after me, wonâ€™t I?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_05: Well, just get on with it then!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_07: I can feel her all around us!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_08: Her grief is everywhere. Sheâ€™s so alone. Everyone she has known is long gone.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_09: Sheâ€¦ misses each of them. Her existence is a solitary one. Her entire world is lost!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_10: The great library she founded, the crimson seas she swam in as a child - all gone. Her sadness is overwhelming! I canâ€™t... agghhhhh!!!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_11: Doctor! Get her out of there! Itâ€™s killing her!
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_12: Iâ€™m all right. I have never felt pain like hers before.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_13: It bubbled inside her, and broke through the reality of the Sphere she was in. It could no longer contain her mind and soul. Thatâ€™s the genesis of all theseâ€¦ Dreamless. And now theyâ€™re here.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_14: No wonder they view the Nexus as they do.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_15: But we canâ€™t let them make the decision for all the others and continue this destruction.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_e7_m6_story03_17: Your friendâ€™s actions have slowed the process by 78.9 earth minutes.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_opening_cutscene: An unstoppable energy wave that threatens all life in the galaxy.
After its appearance in the year 2371, Federation scientists developed technology to harness the energy...
After its first appearance years ago, Federation scientists developed technology to harness the energy...
...and built a starship able to enter the Nexus and rescue those trapped inside.
As you enter the Nexus, it is not the utopian dreamscape survivors have described...
Previous survivors of the Nexus have described a dimension of idealized dreamscapesâ€¦
Once inside the Nexus, you watch helplessly as your crew disappear one by one!
And you are left to face a deadly enemy.
Facing off with a Cardassian warship, you are hailed by a HUMAN voice aboard the vessel...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_summon_cutscene0: Scanning the strange ether within the Nexus, you detect a life sign that matches Starfleet records...
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_accesso: CREW can equip concentrated Nexus energy called NEXUS PARTICLES to increase their POWER.
Upgrading a NEXUS PARTICLE unlocks a random stat, with higher rarity NEXUS PARTICLES unlocking more stats.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_bones_s: Dammit, Jim, Iâ€™m a doctor, not a --
Hey! Where in tarnation am I?
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_gear_sl: CREW can equip GEAR that matches their ROLE to increase their POWER.
Each type of GEAR can only be equipped to a designated slot.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_gear_st: Upgrading GEAR increases its stat bonuses, with higher rarity GEAR unlocking more stats.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_operati: OPERATIONS battles cost DILITHIUM to attempt.
OPERATIONS rotate with each day of the week, and DILITHIUM is refilled each day.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_shuttle: SHUTTLECRAFT missions are unlocked by completing certain missions.
Sending more Crew on a SHUTTLECRAFT mission increases the Jackpot success chance.
Crew sent away on a SHUTTLECRAFT mission are unavailable until the Shuttlecraft mission is Completed or Aborted.
Data_GSCutSceneDialogue_tutorial_worf_su: What trap is this? I was returning from a visit to Qoâ€™noS when my shuttle was struck, and now--
Wait. This appears to be a Starfleet vessel, albeit one I do not know...
Federation vessel, lower your shields and prepare to be boarded!
It appears my arrival was timely. Send me over to their ship and I will silence these Cardassian cowards!
Thereâ€™s no time to waste. You send him to help Burnham on the Cardassian vessel.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode1_Mis: After a successful leap into the Nexus, the U.S.S. Artemis comes under fire from an unknown enemy.
Before Commander Burnham can leave the unknown vessel, its warp core must be disabled.
The U.S.S. Artemis responds to a distress signal from an unknown Federation base.
With no reply from survivors within Federation Base, the away team must investigate the facility with caution.
Project TALOS' defenses have run amok, complicating the search for survivors within the base.
The computer core of Talos must be disabled at all costs, to prevent further loss of life.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode2_Mis: The U.S.S Artemis recieves a message from Starfleet - Captain Kirk has vanished.
The hunt for Kirk brings the away team into conflict with Romulan mercenaries.
The team uncover evidence of a far reaching plot to create an alliance between the Romulans and the Gorn.
On the Gorn homeworld, the away team finds clues that point them to where Kirk is being held.
The away team and Kirk come face to face with one of his oldest foes, the Gorn Commander.
Enraged, Tomalak and the Romulans attack. Only by working togther can Kirk and the Gorn prevail.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode3_Mis: A mysterious signal reaches the U.S.S Artemis from the surface of a desert planet.
In the ruins of a prison transport, the away team find that Gul Dukat has escaped capitivity.
Prisoner secure, the away team hunt for the shuttle's pilot - Odo.
Odo's trail leads into a ruined Borg outpost, buried deep beneath the shifting sands.
In the heart of the Borg outpost the team encounters a mimetic pool, capable of imitating any lifeform.
Alarms sound as the Borg awaken. It's up to the away team to destroy the outpost's power and escape.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode4_Mis: A call for help leads to a colony suffering from a mysterious disease.
Battling against maddened inhabitants, the away team makes its way to Dr Beverly Crusher's clinic.
The infection has claimed Dr. Crusher as a victim. The away team must neutralize her and restore order.
Clues to the disease point towards a Klingon research facility; this outbreak might not be natural.
Cure in hand, the away team return to the colony and attempt to distribute it.
The neural parasites have been dealt with - now only the mastermind behind the attack remains: Khan.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode5_Mis: Tensions are risng between the Federation and the Klingon Empire in the Neutral Zone.
A Klingon Bird-of-Prey has been shot down by a mysterious attacker.
Borg drones are attacking the planet and plan to re-assimilate Seven of Nine.
The away team needs to prevent the Cube from contacting the Collective for more reinforcements.
The Borg are retreating back into a Transwarp conduit and attempting to physically contact the Collective.
Something or someone is still controling the Borg and needs to be stopped.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode6_Mis: The U.S.S. Artemis finds a lone Starfleet vessel, the U.S.S. Pioneer, adrift and unresponsive.
The U.S.S. Pioneer's crew have succumbed to a form of madness that renders them confused and highly aggressive.
Long-ranged scans have revealed a badly damaged Warbird tumbling through space: the I.K.S. Ning'Tao.
Above the planet floats the Cardassian ship Martok warned you about. The Kornaire.
Beaming down to the surface of the planet to find the source of this madness.
To boldly go where no one has gone before.
Data_GSMissions_displayDesc_Episode7_Mis: The U.S.S. Artemis is floating outside the enormous Reality Engine built around a captured star.
To earn the Caretaker's help, the away team much complete four tests, the first being the Test of Faith.
The second test is the Test of Will, pitting the away team against the Borg once more.
Faith and Will may not always be enough, the away team faces the Test of Cunning.
The final test is the Test of Reason, to prove that some conflicts can be settled through dialogue and tact.
Earning the mantle of Engineers, the away team must stop the Dreamless and repair the Reality Engine.
Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mis: THE LOG OF THE U.S.S. PIONEER
NOT WITH A BANG BUT A WHIMPER

Data_GSNodeEncounter_BattleDesc_Unknown: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Data_GSNodeEncounter_BattleDesc_UnknownL: Unknown hostile life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_Defen: The away team pushes forward on high alert, raising their defenses.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e1_m2: Disabling the warp core has critically lowered the Cardassian Morale for the next encounter.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e1_m4: The away team readies their weapons as Worf disables the control panel. Prepared for whatever may be on the other side of the door, the away team receives an Attack Boost.
A methodical approach grants the away team quiet passage into the complex. Unaware of what lurks beyond the door, the away team proceeds with caution, raising their defenses.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e1_m5: The away team pushes forwards toward the med bay in search of supplies. An alternate path has been unlocked.
The away team successfully hacks into the terminal, revealing enemies ahead. The away team pushes forward on high alert, raising their defenses.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e1_m6: Talos has been destroyed. The base has returned to normal.
Talos has been revived. Will it still be murderous, or benign?
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e2_m1: Romulans have advanced upon the away team. Prepare for battle!
The away team have detected incoming Romulans. The away team is prepared for battle and receives a Defense Bonus.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e2_m2: The away team has found intel that reveals Captain Kirkâ€™s location. The team pushes forward down an alternate path.
Hacking the jamming beacon has informed the away team of Sela's location. Prepared for combat, the away team receives an attack bonus.
In their haste to depart, the Romulans left behind supplies. The away team pushes forward, salvaging resources before they leave.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e2_m3: The away team has recovered the Romulan transmissions, and Kirkâ€™s location!
The away team has tracked Gorn, giving them a Speed Boost for the upcoming battle.
The away team have collected additional rewards!
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e2_m4: The away team has tracked Kirkâ€™s position through the desert.
The Gorn has been saved by the away team, and has indicated the captain has headed east.
The away team has gathered resources left behind when Kirk escaped from the Gorn.
Kirk has joined the away team as they escape from the Gorn and Romulan patrols.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e2_m5: Captain Kirk will lead the away team into battle against the Gorn guards The away team receives a Attack Bonus.
Diplomacy with the Gorn has allowed the away team to pass the guards peacefully. The away team receives a Morale Bonus.
The away team has found a path around the guards. The away team receives a Speed Bonus.
The away team passes by, avoiding a potentially dangerous encounter.
The away team saved a group of Federation scientists, who reward the away team with some supplies.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e2_m6: The cautious approach has earned a Defense Bonus for the next battle!
The away team has avoided an encounter with Romulans!
The away team retreats deeper into the base, searching for a better position to defend themselves.
The away team continues on, unable to save the Gorn.
The away team is able to stabilize the Gorn Soldier.
The away team has gathered resources from the surrounding area.
The away team disables the Romulan device, giving them a Defense Bonus in upcoming battles.
The away team is able to override the device, sending the Romulans into disarray, lowering their Defense.
The away team has gathered resources from the surrounding area.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e3_m1: A trail leads away from the device. Perhaps once used by those who built it. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
The away team successfully hacked the strange device, disabling it. Feeling hopeful, the team receives a Morale Boost.
The away team follows the large group of footprints. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
Exploring the narrow path reveals a shortcut through the rocks. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e3_m2: The away team follows the debris, revealing a small, sheltered trail. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
Signs of a scuffle lead the team to believe that the assailant went east. The away team collects supplies left behind then pushes forward.
Scanning the ship's logs has revealed that the pilot was Odo, who is nowhere to be found. The away team advances on high alert, receiving a Defense Bonus.
A smoldering firepit and footprints reveal that Dukat is close. The away team advances down an alternate path on high alert, receiving a Defense Bonus.
A tracking cuff confirms that Dukat is close. The away team pushes down an alternate path in pursue of him.
As the storm worsens, the away team quickly pursues footprints leading away from the campsite. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
With Dukat's position and plans to escape revealed, the away team gains an advantage. Feeling hopeful, the Team receives a Morale Boost.
The away team successfully salvages some medical supplies from the shelter.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e3_m3: The away team pushes forward into the canyon, revealing a clearing ahead. The away team has unlocked an alternate path.
The away team pushes forward up a narrow gap in the rocks. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
The away team pulls back, avoiding an encounter with Klingon Bandits. While retreating, a combadge buried in the sand reveals Odo was here. The away team pushes forward in their pursuit.
The away team ambushes nearby Klingon bandits! Gaining the tactical advantage, the away team receives a Speed Bonus.
The away team successfully hacked the strange device, disabling it. Feeling hopeful, the team receives a Morale Boost.
Using their phasers the away team is able to create a small gap in the rock around the door and squeeze inside.
Scans reveal a large, underground, structure teeming with energy. Prepared for combat, the away team pushes forward receiving an Attack Bonus.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e3_m4: The away team pushes forward through the waste, placing them deeper in the structure. Footprints trailing away from the waste indicate that the away team is not alone.
The away team pulls back in an attempt to avoid the hazardous waste spill. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
Examining the alcove reveals that the Borg have been dormant for hundreds of years, but why are they here? The away team proceeds with caution, receiving a Defense Bonus.
The away team cautiously advances forward in their pursuit of Odo. The away team proceeds with caution, receiving a Defense Bonus.
The away team quickly pushes forward in their pursuit of Odo. Feeling determined, the away team receives a Speed Bonus.
The Borg device is disabled from multiple phasers shots. With phasers in hand, the away team receives an Attack Bonus.
The Borg systems have detected the hacking intrusion and has alerted nearby Borg drones.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e3_m5: The away team pushes forward down the left corridor in search of Odo. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
The away team pushes forward down the right corridor in search of Odo. The away team has discovered an alternate path.
The away team disables the shield and frees Odo.
The away team overloads the shield with sustained fire from their phasers and frees Odo.
The away team fires their phasers collapsing the room onto the pool.
The away team gathers a sample of the fluid in the pool.
The away team establishes a link with the fluid. It's confused, frightened... and angry.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e3_m6: The away team charges towards the Borg, receiving an Attack Bonus.
Being severely outnumbered, the away team wisely chooses to find another route. The away team receives a Speed Bonus.
Rerouting the power to the shields, the away team receives a Defense Bonus.
The away team disrupts the Borg's local communication, slowing the reactions of the Borg drones.
The away team ruptures the chemcial pipe and the Borg as weakened as their wade through the corrosive chemicals.
The away team is able to partially sedate the organic components of the Borg, reducing the effectiveness of Borg attacks.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e4_m1: The stabilized officer indicates a path through the forest for the team to explore.
The away team continues on towards the Federation outpost.
The away team collects a small handful of resources.
The PADD reveals the position of nearby infected Starfleet officers.
Accessing the device has led the away team to a nearby group of Romulans, who may have information about the infection.
Phasers at the ready, the away team moves further towards the medical cache.
Most of the crates are empty, but a few still hold useful supplies.
Before falling unconscious, the medic gives the away team a hypospray containing a regenerative agent.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e4_m2: The away teamâ€™s phasers make short work of the wreckage, opening the path forward.
The away team is able to override the doorâ€™s security protocols and open a path forward.
The stabilized Starfleet engineer gives the away team a shield for upcoming battles.
The Neurazine has neutralized the infected outside, allowing the away team to avoid battle.
The away team opens the doors, allowing the infected inside. Theyâ€™re thrust into combat.
A quick injection of Cordrazine prepares the away team for battle, the away team receives an Attack Boost.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e4_m3: Without an obvious cure for Dr. Crusher, the away team heads out in search of Theragen to complete her research.
Dr. Crusherâ€™s disease has been slowed, but not stopped. She may be able to give the away team valuable information.
The away team examines Dr. Crusherâ€™s research into the disease, the away team receives a Morale Boost.
The away team slowly moves from crate to crate. Most are empty. One, marked Federation Prax X-345 supplies isn't.
The away team scans the warehouse and quickly finds the Theragen.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e4_m4: The away team decides against confrontation, looking for a safer way into the outpost.
The away team is prepared to risk combat to get the cure and get back to Dr. Crusher. The away team receives an Attack Boost.
A diplomatic approach has avoided combat with the guards.
The away teamâ€™s search reveals notes on a modified form of Betatephlin, used as a carrier for a parasitic life form. This discovery will help create a cure.
The away team dashes out a nearby exit, leaving the lab before any guards can arrive. The away team receives a Speed Boost.
Using diplomacy, the away team convinced the scientist to give them the cure for the disease.
The away team expertly works the machines, quickly harvesting enough samples to synthesize a cure.
The away team prepares to fight the pursuing guards.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e4_m5: The away team activates the air filtration unit to start dispersing the cure throughout the outpost.
The stabilized Engineer is able to set up a defense grid for the away team. The away team receives a Defense Boost.
The away team rushes back to Dr. Crusher, even though the path is perilous.
The away team focuses on activating the filtration unit, only to be shocked as infected personnel emerge and surround them! It's a trap!
The away team warily scans the area and discovers life signs, an ambush! Reactly quickly, the away team prepares for battle. The away team receives a Speed Boost.
The away team searches the nearby storage containers for any additional supplies, interrupted by the sound of approaching infected.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e4_m6: The away team is able to bypass security protocols and hack into the defense network to open the doors. The away team receives a Defense Bonus.
The repeated firing of phasers against the door has attracted unwanted attention.
A quick search of the outpost's blueprints reveals an alternate entrance that should be unlocked.
The away team helps the officer to his feet, and he nods gratefully. He provides them with what few medical supplies he has and the codes to the door.
The away team decides not to waste any of the remaining cure. Better to save it for emergencies.
The filtration unit is activated, dispersing the cure throughout the area. Nearby infected are neutralized allowing the away team to avoid battle.
In such dangerous situations, it pays to use every resource available. Luckily there's a crate of those nearby.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e5_m1: The away team searches for an alternate path leading them around the noxious area. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team bravely plunge into the noxious cloud... and immediately regret their decision as their throats and eyes begin to burn. The away team suffers an <b>Attack Penalty<b>.
Heeding the advice of McCoy, the away team gives him a moment to prepare a counter-reagent to deal with the effects of the gas.
High tensions and a misunderstanding results in a sudden escalation towards violence.
Steady heads prevail and after some quick negotiations the Klingons sheath their weapons.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e5_m2: Aiming carefully, the away team's phasers cut through the dense foliage, carving a path through the forest. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Carefully the away team retraces their footsteps. The forest widens back out and soon they're able to find a new path forward.
Quickly, the away team spreads out around the clearing at key positions. When the mercenaries return, they'll be ready. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.

The away team begins to patch up the wounded Klingons. The mercenaries might attack at any moment, but the away team wonâ€™t sacrifice Federation values in the face of fear. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
The away team vanishes into the surrounding forest and stay silent, waiting for the mercenaries to blunder into their trap. The enemy team suffers a <b>Defense Penalty<b>.
The away team sets off into the forest to catch the mercenaries unprepared at their camp. The away team receives an <b>Attack Bonus<b>.
The away team hurries towards the Sphere but quickly stumbles into a cluster of drones.
Scans of the area reveal several Borg drones approaching, the away team prepares for battle. The away team receives a <b>Tech Bonus<b>.
The away team cautiously searches the surrounding area, and encounters a group of Borg drones heading towards them. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e5_m3: The last thing the away team needs is more enemies. It's time to deal with these mercenaries once and for all.
Surprisingly, the mercenaries take the away team's words to heart. Hands ease off phasers and one of them even offers to help fight the intruders.  The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
Normally the away team would stop them, but today seems to be their lucky day. The away team have a friend to save. The away team runs on and their shouts and jeers quickly fade behind them.
A moment later the hack works and the door slides open. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
A few shots with the away team's phasers burn through the door's mechanisms. The away team is able to shoulder it aside and move on into the complex. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team turns and heads back, eyes peeled for a doorway or vent. There has to be another route into the complex and they need to find it
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e5_m4: Tapping into the network, the away team learns of Cube's intent to rejoin the Collective.
The away team is able to tap into the remodulation network and effectively block the Borg from seeing them as intruders. It won't hold for long. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.

Tapping into the nearby circuitry the away team sets up a relay to bypass the current around the room. Moments later, the lights in the room flicker then go out. Everything around them is silent.  The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Gripping their phasers tightly, the away team charges forward in hopes of gaining the upper hand.
The away team decides to leave the data distribution node alone and move on. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Phaser fire reduces the node to atoms, but a moment later, the blare of an alarm sounds through the complex.
The away team reprogram the node and move forward, ignored by a few Borg who march past, oblivious to their presence. The away team receives a Defense Bonus.
The nearby recharging stations are disabled, keeping the drones docked in them in stasis. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e5_m5: The phasers shudder in the away team's hands but after a moment the forcefield flickers and drops, freeing the prisoners. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
The forcefield shuts down long enough for the prisoners to flood out of the chamber to safety before reactivating. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
The away team manipulates the Cube into diverting power into a non-existent critical repair, and away from the forcefield. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
The Borg network is growing resistant to the away team's intrusions. But the away team acquires a rudimentary layout of the Borg Cube. The away team discovers an Alternate Path.
Accessing the Borg network proves unsuccessful as the amount of information is too vast and the network becomes more resistant to the away team's interference.
The phaser blast strikes the shield to little effect. The energy wall seems to shift for a moment, then adapt. An alarm starts blaring...
The away team is able to disable the forcefield for a moment, but before any of the prisoners can escape, it reactivates. The Borg have obviously adapted. An alarm soundsâ€¦
Any energy the away team attempts to drain is immediately restored. The Borg have adapted to the manipulations of their systems.  Somewhere nearby, an alarm sounds...
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e5_m6: Charging forward, the away team barrels directly into the drones. Theyâ€™re thrown back, falling over one another.
The away team retreats towards the smaller group, hoping to break out before they can surround them. The away team receives a <b>Speed Bonus<b>.
The away team searches for another way to access the Transwarp drive. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team decides to find another node that will allow them to power down the barrier.
The away team sets their phasers to randomly modulate frequencies to delay the Borg ability to adapt. The away team receives an <b>Attack Bonus<b>.
Remembering their tactical training, the away team forms into a defensive formation. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.
Trapped and with no other options, the away team decides to strike first.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e6_m1: The away team disables the security forcefield and continues down the corridor. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team squeezes into the jefferies tube and crawls towards the next section of the corridor. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team turns around and leaves the security forcefield to look for another way forward.
The away team fires a phaser burst into the crowd of infected and retreats into the corridor prepared to fight.  The enemy team suffers a <b>Defense Penalty<b>.
Focused on rescuing the survivor, the away team charges towards the crowd of infected.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e6_m2: To avoid getting surrounded and trapped in sickbay, the away team immediately sets out towards the Astrometrics Lab. The away team receives a <b>Speed Bonus<b>.
The away team swiftly surveys the sickbay and gathers up some of the undamaged supplies.
Accessing the medical logs has revealed the infection started 3 days, but no clues about the initial cause.
The away team opens the door to the quarters. Unfortunately there is no left to save.
The away team opens the door to the quarters. Unfortunately there is no left to save.
Getting to the astrometrics lab is the top priority as the away team presses forward.
Diverting some of the remaining power in the ship to the turbolift, the away team boards it and rides up several decks to the astrometric lab. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
Determined to reach the astrometrics lab, the away team makes the long climb up the turbolift shaft. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The turbolift is beyond repair, the away team searches for another route to the astrometrics lab.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e6_m3: The away team decides to head down the corridor to the left.
The away team decides to head down the corridor to the right.
With the structural integrity field activated, the away team safety passes through the breached corridor. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Rather than risk the integrity field collapsing while in the breached corridor, the away team elects to find another way to the bridge.
No physical wounds and yet the klingons in sickbay still met an unfortunate end.
Even the klingon doctor succumbed to the infection, the away team proceeds forward with renewed caution.
Quickly surveying the sickbay, the away team is able to scavenge a small amount of supplies before moving on.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e6_m4: Splitting up the infected Cardassians into smaller groups should make them easier to deal with. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.
With the warp core failing, the away team charges towards the Cardassians. The away team receives an <b>Attack Bonus<b>.
Getting to the warp core is paramount. The away team runs to find another route to the engine room.  The away team receives a <b>Speed Bonus<b>.
Through quick action and expertise, the away team is able to warp core under control.
With seconds to spare the away team ejects the warp core from the ship.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e6_m5: The away team continues towards the Cardassian camp, hopeful they will find a survivor.
The away team agree to track down the source of the mysterious signal. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team takes a moment to process what they've just learned.
Unfortunately there's nothing the away team can do for these Cardassians.
The away team sifts through the remains of the Cardassian camp and discovers some supplies.
The away scans the area and makes contact with a strange entity.
The away team finds multiple sets of footprints nearby while scouting the area.
The away team moves forward with renewed resolve. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
The away team carefully moves forward. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e6_m6: The away team heads down the path to the left. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team heads down the path to the right. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Scanning the technology provides more questions than answers.
Analyzing the ancient technology, the away team theorize it might be possible to repair the Nexus itself.
The away team attempts to grasp the scope of how ancient this technology could be.
Looking to avoid combat, the away team ventures down the path to the left. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team advances straight towards the group of creatures.
Avoiding detection, the away team heads for the path on the right. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e7_m1: Using one the of the Reactors the away team is able to disable the forcefield blocking their path.
The away team continues to explore the facility. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
The away team uses a Reactor to unlock the locked door and discover some supplies.
Choosing caution over curiosity, the away team moves on.
The away team successfully leaps to the platform and discovers some supplies.
The away team ignores the platform and moves on, not wanting to risk possible injury.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e7_m2: Scanning the runabout for damage, the shapeshifters posing as Federation attack the away team. The away team receives a <b>Tech Bonus<b>.
The shapeshifters spring their ambush catching the away team flat-footed. The away team receives a Speed Penalty.
Searching the runabout the away team discovers some supplies before being attacked by the shapeshifters.
The abandoned supplies are another shapeshifter ambush. Prepare for combat.
Wary of a possible trap, the away team moves on.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e7_m3: Accessing the Borg sensors, the away team has discovered a new path forward and hopes their intrusion has gone unnoticed.
Drawing less attention, the away team chooses to continue exploring the Borg Cube. The away team discovers an <b>Alternate Path<b>.
Overloading the power in the Borg alcove has disabled it and the drones that were recharging. The away team receives a <b>Defense Bonus<b>.
The away team chooses to avoid interacting with the Borg alcove.
Searching through the Borg parts and materials, the away team discovers some supplies.
The away team ignores the spare Borg technology and moves forward.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e7_m4: Applying their medical assistance, the away team helps to get the wounded personnel mobile. The Starfleet medic hands them some additional supplies as thanks.
To protect the wounded personnel, the away team charges in the direction of the approaching Klingons. The away team receives an <b>Attack Bonus<b>.
With little time remaining, the away team pushes forward.
Using one of the Reactors to alter the "reality", the away team discovers some supplies.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e7_m5: Not an overtly peaceful resolution, the away team was able to avoid combat.
A hostile reception from the Romulans unfortunately has lead to combat.
While not entirely convinced, Sela has allowed the away team to proceed while avoiding combat.
Unwilling to trust the Federation, Sela and the Romulans attack.
Able to secure a diplomatic outcome, the away team avoids combat.
Unable to reach a diplomatic solution, the away team prepares for combat.
Data_GSNodeExploration_ResultsDesc_e7_m6: The away team chooses to continue on the left path.
The away team chooses to continue on the right path.
Determined to stop the Dreamless, the away team readies themselves for combat. The away team receives a <b>Morale Bonus<b>.
The away team prepares to meet the Dreamless in combat and save the Reality Engine.
Scanning the Dreamless has given the away team an advantage in the upcoming battle. The away team receives a <b>Tech Bonus<b>.

Data_GSSummonSetup_locDesc_rarechest2: Chance of getting epic to Very Rare Crew
